story:
•  

     Here I´m just passing the hat- free hugs and love in exchange!!!


    I strongly believe (because of how live has treated me) that things happen in your life when they have a reason to be, that you meet the "right" people when you have to meet them, I know that life will give us what we need when we really need it, when it´s the right time for you to get it, not before nor after! We just gotta be patient and go for whatever we wish in life to be happpy!

    I´m an actor/dancer a life lover, a performer, a son, a brother, an uncle, a friend, a human! I come from a humble family from down Central América, from Costa Rica to be specific, I´ve studied mainly drama and dance for about four years back home, always having the "weight" on my shoulders of knowing that since I´m not from a wealthy family, this career is not for me as they say and as you can clearly see! But then I said to my self:

    -you know what? fuck that!-

    If this is what I love doing in my life I´ll simply go for it, no matter what the circumstances are or how challenging it will be, I don´t care, or I´d say: I do care, I care about having a challenge while pursuing what I want for my life, at the end of the day all what you can get out of any challenge is nothing but tons of learning and positive experience for life!

    So I did get into Arts school, for some reason once I got there I always felt like I was not having what I wanted, what I needed, to be at a good physical and intelectual level to perform in many diferent ways, to be a well qualified performer because of his skills and his good school education;

    besides that I´d always see friends and colleagues including myself, sort of "adorating" most of the artists who come to perform in Costa Rica, performers who come from North América or Europe to do a show and then everybody is talking about how great there are, but that´s all they do, it seems like they don´t think:

    -we can be as dedicated as they are, do a great job as good as they do on scene, it´s not that their bodies or brains are more capable than ours, we all are humans with same of posibilities to learn and evolve physically, mentally and spiritually. BUt any way, I didn´t find it over there...

    So I had a strong feeling after one year I started school, I promised to myself that I was going to study abroad, that I was going to be a great performer and that I´d go back home one day, full of experiences to share, to guide in learning processes in one of those arts schools maybe, and try to make a difference for better!

    So here I am, it´s been almost a year and a half since I left home, I went to the US for a few months, then to Canada for a year, always looking for schools, oppotunities, where to study as a "foreigner" (not easy this absurd thing of being a "FOREIGNER" while being in the same planet), and working to survive and try to save up some money for school while doing the big research:

    Where to study? where to settle down? where to be accepted? despite the fact that we all are human beings we still need to do tests and interviews to be accepted because "WE DON´T BELONG" to that place on earth! Humm, there´s something what doesn´t match in my head...

    but, any ways...

    after so many places that I´ve been through, people, adventures, ups and downs, emotional encounters, traveling, living, couchsurfing and so many other experiences...

    Finally I found a school in Madrid, Spain!

    where they don´t do extra charges for being a "foreigner" for instance; where I´m able to apply for a scholarship for the tuition of the school as much as national students (as they call them).

    What I haven´t been able to do while traveling is to save up enough money to afford the cost of the living for at least the first year (in order to get a student visa I have to prove to the Spanish goverment that I have all the money I need to pay for my living cost for all the time what I´m asking the visa for! I don´t have it all, it´s a 4 year program- but there most be something I can do about it once I´m enrolled in school).

    I started this fund raising to get the money to afford the cost of the living for at least the first year, so I have something to show them to get my student visa, it might help.

    I really need to make this campaign work I have only 4 days left and if I don´t make it, even if I get enrolled succesfully at the University I won´t be accepted by the inmigration laws.

    It´s been a long journey and I don´t want to see it falling down just because I don´t have the money

    ...as I was told since the begining!

    It´s not that easy, it makes you feel vulnerable, sort of naked infront of the whole world, but if it´s what it takes to get where I want to be, I willing to!

    ...this is me... this is my campaign: 

    Thanks for helping...

     much love!

    Luis Enrique!

I don´t have it all, it´s a 4 year program- but there most be something I can do about it once I´m enrolled in school).

It´s been a long journey and I don´t want to see it falling down just because I don´t have the money
...as I was told since the begining!
It´s not that easy, it makes you feel vulnerable, sort of naked infront of the whole world, but if it´s what it takes to get where I want to be, I willing to!
...this is me... this is my campaign: 
Thanks for helping...
 much love!
Luis Enrique!

story:
Background of the Project

Foreign Direct Investment has transformed northern Mexico and, in particular, Ciudad Juarez. It has contributed to tremendous economic growth but also has affected every aspect of daily life, from the environment, manufacturing, labor, urban planning, supply chains, violence, etc. Although the name of Ciudad Juarez, in recent years, has been known around the world as a place of crime and social distress, this border city should also be known as one of resiliency where Foreign Direct Investment can still play an essential and beneficial role.

Ciudad Juarez is now undertaking a dramatic effort to recover and use its strategic position to benefit its communities through better planning and management. In this context, two young, talented, and enterprising students from the Autonomous University of Ciudad Juarez (UACJ) have taken it upon themselves to study, understand and learn about the structures and practices governing Foreign Direct Investment in order to apply their knowledge to the benefit of Ciudad Juarez.

For many decades, Ciudad Juarez has been in a passive position with respect to capital flows and the laws which govern them. For the fist time in the city's and region's history, two students from UACJ are making an effort and commitment to understand these dynamics so that the region can play a more proactive role in realizing the substantial benefits of Foreign Direct investment.  

What is the Foreign Direct Investment Moot (FDI Moot)?

The Foreign Direct Investment International Arbitration Moot is an academic competition which simulates the international procedures for resolving disputes between Investors and States, through writing briefs and oral arguments, by bringing together students, professors and legal professionals from around the world. This year, 2014, the site of the competition will be Pepperdine University in Malibu, California (USA). Law Schools from all over the world can participate in this academic experience which teaches law students not only about International Investment Law and how to write memorials and argue in oral hearings, but also provides them a unique opportunity to practice with students from different countries and show their talents and capabilities to the practitioners and professors who serve as judges and arbitrators. More information can be found here: http://www.fdimoot.org/index.php

The Participation of a Team from Ciudad Juarez

The FDI Moot has never included the participation of a team from anywhere in Mexico, much less a public university in the northern states. In fact, the team from Ciudad Juarez will be the only participating team from Mexico. Moreover, whereas private Mexican law schools sometimes participate in similar events, providing substantial financing to their teams, this year's participation from Ciudad Juarez is receiving no financing from UACJ. Indeed, up to this point, all expenses have been borne by the two participants, Hector and Monica, and their coach Patrick Schaefer.

The Team

Our two participants are Hector Arce and Monica Rubalcaba. Both are students of exceptional ability and strength of character. They have sacrificed a great deal in personal and economic terms to make it this far in the competition because of how important they know this project to be for their professional development and the future of the region.

Hector came to Ciudad Juarez five years ago from the state of Sonora in order to study Law at the UACJ. He has lived in Juarez independently, working his way through school, while still achieving the highest grade point average of the entire university.

Monica is a Ciudad Juarez native from a middle class family which has always encouraged her to achieve her academic and professional goals. She is about to begin her last year in UACJ Law School. In the past, Monica worked for the UACJ in research projects which helped to develop fundamental skills for the FDI Moot. She now has one of the top five grade point averages in UACJ Law School.

The Coach

Patrick Schaefer has been coaching Monica and Hector in this project since late April of 2014. As a lawyer specialized in International Investment and Financial Law, he has been able to provide instruction, guidance and preparation, as well as moral support for the team and the project. His knowledge and contribution to the effort have been essential to its success. Moreover, Patrick has been traveling from the United States to Ciudad Juarez three times a week, donating his time and energy to meet and study with the students at their university.

What we Need?

Most of all, this effort has required strength of character, vision, and moral commitment. It is, after all, a labor of love. Even so, there are certain economic costs associated with the project. As mentioned previously, all involved are making significant sacrifices of time, energy and money. And, without the support of the university, it is critical to raise the funds for our travel to and lodging in California for the days of the competition later in October.

Bellow you will find a clarification of our costs. Even though the costs are relatively small in absolute terms, they represent an unreachable amount for Hector and Monica. Any assistance you can provide to this effort will make not only an unprecedented difference in the lives of Hector and Monica, but also in the lives and communities of Ciudad Juarez and Northern Mexico.

Breakdown of costs:

Registration Fee: 767 USD (600 euros)

Copies of the Book, The Elements of Style, Strunk and White: 37.60 USD

Notebooks and Supplies: 75.15 USD

Gas, El Paso to Pepperdine University, Round Trip: 400 USD

Lodging at Hostel, IAH Santa Monica: 2,257.20 USD

Business Suits: 1,000 USD (500 USD each student)

Food and incidentals: 840 (60 USD x 7 days x 2 students) USD

Why is this project so important?

Our project represents the courage and pioneering spirit of both these students and Ciudad Juarez. Not only do these individuals, Monica and Hector, seek to improve their own legal practice and knowledge, but also to do so for the benefit of their city and its future generations.
For Ciudad Juarez, and perhaps the entire border region, the importance of having professionals educated, knowledgeable and capable of dealing with Foreign Direct Investment is fundamental for the economic and social development of the city. This is an important and symbolic opportunity for Ciudad Juarez, a city that strives everyday to overcome its challenges, and we hope that you can play a part in creating a brighter future.

story:
BIO & PROJECT SUMMARY


ABOUT ME: 

I am graduating from New York University as a  Master of Arts graduate in the Department of English in May 2014! My research at NYU is focused on the intersections of race, gender and sexuality in contemporary American literature. Over the last two years I have presented formal papers on Black  Studies at Princeton University, University of North Carolina, New York University Paris, and CUNY. Over the summer I pursued my research interests at NYU Paris, exploring the black expatriate experiences of African American writers, artists and entertainers who relocated in France in the 1950s. Outside of work and graduate school, I also serve as the President of the NYU Graduate School of Arts and Science Graduate Student Government. 


ABOUT THE CONFERENCE: 

James Baldwin left America in 1948 for Paris.  It was to be the first of his sites of expatriation: from Switzerland, to Turkey, to his final decades in St.-Paul-de-Vence, and frequent returns to New York, the American South, and San Francisco, Baldwin was, to use his term, a “transatlantic commuter.”  The Atlantic runs in many directions, and has many currents, not unlike Baldwin, an author of immense depth, mystery, and variety.  This conference, emphasizing the way Baldwin combined engagement and exile, will add to a burgeoning body of Baldwin scholarship as scholars attempt to understand and appreciate one of American literature’s most fascinating figures.


ABOUT THE PANEL(ISTS): 

I'll be presenting on Friday, June 6th, 2014 from 10:30-11:45AM 

Panel J: "Revisiting Familiar Works"

 Chair: Ashraf Rushdy (Wesleyan University)

Pekka Kilpeläinen (University of Eastern Finland). “Jazz Club as a Space of Resistance in ‘Sonny’s Blues’ and Just Above My Head”

Rashad Shabazz (University of Vermont). “Black Radicalism and the Erotic: Remapping the Boundaries of Blackness in Another Country.”

Gabrielle Royal (New York University). "Imagining Home and Queering Borders: Transatlantic Baldwin and the Contemporary American Novel”


WHY FUNDING IS IMPORTANT: 

Funding for this conference super important! I would like to put my degree to good use by SHARING my research and learning tools with the greater community. This conference takes me back to Baldwin's roots, while studying his life and legacy. I will be able to connect with other scholars in my field, and graduates who are contributing to the growth of our learning community! PLEASE consider contributing! THANK YOU, THANK YOU! 


FINANCIAL BREAKDOWN 

Funding for this conference is broken down into three categories: 

1. Travel Expenses (including 1 roundtrip plane ticket, train ticket, and/or cabs): approximately $2,500.00 USD 

2. Lodging Expenses (Airbnb or Hostel)X 10 days: approximately $800.00 USD

3. Conference Registration Fees: $200.00 USD  


CONTRIBUTOR "PERKS"

ALL Contributors will receive special PERKS from abroad!!!

Contributors within the $10.00-$50.00 range receive:

a personalized post card with a  special "thank you" message sent to your mailbox directly from Monpieller, Paris, Versailles, or London!

Contributors within the $50.00-$150.00 range receive:

access to an exclusive online media album with pictures and video documenting my travels during the conference across the beautiful landscape of France/UK! 

Contributors within the $150.00 and above range receive: 

ALL perks listed above AND A GIFT OF YOUR CHOICE (please specify from which city) sent to your doorstep!

story:
This is an invitation for you to participate and/or fund a leadership training. The nature of this training is an intention to cause a transformation in the very fabric of the Greek society. To cause a shift in the thinking of a society is bold, and by the standards of most intelligent beings, impossible. That is exactly what has moved us to take this on . . . to do that which cannot be done . . . and perhaps fail . . . but to dare to succeed! 

We Want to Cause the Following Shifts: 

FROM BLAMING OTHERS, TO PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY 

FROM HELPLESSNESS, TO "WE CAN DO IT" 

FROM WAITING, TO ACTION 

FROM "NO POSSIBILITY" TO "POSSIBILITY"

We will begin with approximately 40 people in Athens, on the 30 of May 2014. 

We have to admit that the structure of this initiative is alive, which means it is growing and evolving even as we write this. Therefore, we do not yet know all the answers . . .or even the questions. We just know that we are committed to this initiative and we are inviting others to join us, because if we wait to identify all the questions and answers we might never start. 

We would like to invite you to be one of the next people who will participate or contribute to the first 40!

Here is what we know for sure at this point:

We will begin with 40 people in Octomber, in participating in a 3 month, Transformative  Leadership Training, in Athens. This training is designed to be of high impact to each person individually. During the course of the three months, participants will have the opportunity to exam the nature of their thinking, as it relates to themselves, their life, their family, their work, their community and Greece. Then they will have an opportunity to invent new thinking in these same areas where they would like to cause a different outcome than the one they currently have. We promise that these 3 months will be valuable. 

If you want to participate in the preparation process for a training like that, you can participate in a three day workshop held in the 30 of May and an other three day workshop held in 20 of June.
At the conclusion of the preparation you will be invited to make a commitment to continue. Be clear the continuation is completely separate from the 3-day workshop. It is fine to commit only to the workshop, although we really would love it if you choose to continue, but that will be for you to decide then. Nevertheless, we would like you to know that we will invite you to participate in the follow up sessions of the workshop and if you choose to participate in the 3 months Leadership Training you will commit to the following: 

> Take on a project in your life that benefits the Greek society, to be accomplished within three months. This should be something which you have no idea how you could accomplish it, you would love it, and it looks highly unlikely that you could do it. Something that would make a difference and that is specific and measureable. You will design this during the training, if you choose to. You will receive coaching to support you in fulfilling this project! 

Follow-up sessions

You will be invited to participate in a minimum of 4 out of 6, 3-hour follow up sessions over the course of one year. These will usually take place on a Weeknight from 19:00 to 22:00.

Who can participate?

Anyone can participate! You must be at least 18 years old and committed to the preceding (15-18 years old may participate if a parent is participating with them.) 

Who are we?

We, the sponsors of this training, are only committed Greek citizens who imagine a brighter future for our community, our friends, families and our children. 

Reserve your place!

We would love for you to join us in this! If you choose to participate, contact us at http://metamorfosis.gr/?page_id=47

Facilitators

Many Greek citizens who took on similar projects and completed them under the coaching of www.metamorfosis.gr

For nearly 6 years Metamorfosis has been working with leaders and their teams to produce breakthrough results. Having done research in the nature of leadership and team work we have been able to apply the results of that research in our trainings and consultancy, literally, obliterating the constraints that are inherent in any person leading to consistent and continual results beyond the predictable. 

Metamorfosis has delivered cultural shifts in 300 people and their teams as well as to individuals and has been an experimantative organization on the subject of applying metamorphosis thinking in different forms like theater and lectures. 

We are passionate about people leading lives they love! We are committed to eliminating the false causes of people's lack of performance, which has them not have the lives they want, and in business the results they long for. 

The founders of Metamorfosis did studies in Psychology and live in Athens, Greece.
story_txt:
This is an invitation for you
to participate and/or fund a leadership training. The nature of
this training is an intention to cause a transformation in the very fabric
of the Greek society. To cause a shift in the thinking of a society is
bold, and by the standards of most intelligent beings, impossible. That is
exactly what has moved us to take this on . . . to do that which cannot be
done . . . and perhaps fail . . . but to dare to succeed! 
We Want to Cause the Following Shifts: 
FROM BLAMING OTHERS, TO PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITY
AND ACCOUNTABILITY FROM HELPLESSNESS, TO "WE CAN DO IT" FROM WAITING, TO ACTION FROM "NO POSSIBILITY" TO "POSSIBILITY"
We will begin with approximately 40 people in Athens, on the 30 of May 2014. 
We have to admit that the structure of this initiative is alive, which means it
is growing and evolving even as we write this. Therefore, we do not
yet know all the answers . . .or even the questions. We just know that we are
committed to this initiative and we are inviting others to join us, because
if we wait to identify all the questions and answers we might never
start. 
We would like to invite you to be one of the next people who will participate
or contribute to the first 40!
Here is what we know for sure at this point:
We will begin with 40 people in Octomber, in participating in a 3 month,
Transformative  Leadership Training, in Athens. This training is designed
to be of high impact to each person individually. During the course of the
three months, participants will have the opportunity to exam the nature of
their thinking, as it relates to themselves, their life, their family,
their work, their community and Greece. Then they will have an opportunity
to invent new thinking in these same areas where they would like to cause
a different outcome than the one they currently have. We promise
that these 3 months will be valuable.  
If you want to participate in the preparation process for a training like
that, you can participate in a three day workshop held in the 30 of May and an other three day workshop held in 20 of June.
At the conclusion of the preparation you will be invited to make a
commitment to continue. Be clear the continuation is completely separate
from the 3-day workshop. It is fine to commit only to the
workshop, although we really would love it if you choose to continue, but
that will be for you to decide then. Nevertheless, we would like you to
know that we will invite you to participate in the follow up sessions of
the workshop and if you choose to participate in the 3 months Leadership
Training you will commit to the following: 
> Take on a project in your life that benefits the Greek society, to be
accomplished within three months. This should be something which you have
no idea how you could accomplish it, you would love it, and it looks
highly unlikely that you could do it. Something that would make a
difference and that is specific and measureable. You will design this
during the training, if you choose to. You will receive coaching to support you
in fulfilling this project!  
Follow-up sessions
You will be invited to participate in a minimum of 4 out of 6, 3-hour
follow up sessions over the course of one year. These will usually take
place on a Weeknight from 19:00 to 22:00.
Who can participate?
Anyone can participate! You must be at least 18 years old and committed to
the preceding (15-18 years old may participate if a parent is
participating with them.) 
Who are we?
We, the sponsors of this training, are only committed Greek citizens
who imagine a brighter future for our community, our friends, families and
our children. 
Reserve your place!
We would love for you to join us in this! If you choose to participate,
contact us at http://metamorfosis.gr/?page_id=47
Facilitators
Many Greek citizens who took on similar projects
and completed them under the coaching of www.metamorfosis.gr
For nearly 6 years Metamorfosis has been working with leaders and
their teams to produce breakthrough results. Having done research in the
nature of leadership and team work we have been able to apply the results
of that research in our trainings and consultancy, literally, obliterating
the constraints that are inherent in any person leading to consistent and
continual results beyond the predictable. 
Metamorfosis has delivered cultural shifts in 300 people and their teams as
well as to individuals and has been an experimantative organization on the
subject of applying metamorphosis thinking in different forms like theater and
lectures. 
We are passionate about people leading lives they love! We are committed
to eliminating the false causes of people's lack of performance, which has
them not have the lives they want, and in business the results they long
for. 
The founders of Metamorfosis did studies in Psychology and live in Athens,
Greece.

story:
My Personal Introduction

My name is Edgar Rojas and I am from Juarez City, Mexico. Currently studying at National Taiwan University of Science and Technology as part of the International Master of Business Administration program. My main highlights are:

·  2008-2013. Permanent holder of the Excellence Scholarship (Autonomous University of Ciudad Juarez).

·  October 2010. Distinction as "Top Outstanding Student" having obtained the highest grades in 2010 (Autonomous University of Ciudad Juarez).

·  2012-2013. Scholarship holder and promoter of the Scholarship Programs of the Government of the Republic of China, the University Mobility in Asia and the Pacific and the Special Scholarship of the Autonomous University of Ciudad Juarez in mobility.

·  2014-2016. Holder of the Taiwan Ministry of Education Scholarship for Master studies.

As a scholarship student in Taiwan, I have always had a great appreciation for Asia culture in general, mainly in countries where Mandarin Chinese is used. Mandarin language has become my inspiration and first goal to achieve. During my short stay in Taiwan, I've been studying Mandarin for myself every day and in different ways.

My Personal Proposal

I believe taking intensive courses of Mandarin would be the best way in which I could learn Chinese in a successful way. I do not have the necessary resources to finance myself to take intensive courses of Mandarin Chinese. Therefore, I would like to ask for your help to fund this personal project.

My proposal is to request funding to support intensive Mandarin courses during my stay in Taiwan. The project would consist of four 3-months intensive courses of 15 hours each week. During a year of intensive study of Mandarin, I would complete the elementary and intermediate levels, learning 1500 Chinese characters, 3000 word collocations and phrases, and more than 400 sentence patterns by the end of the intermediate classes. The high-quality and convenient educational institutions where I could take these intensive Mandarin courses are the following ones: Language Center of National Taiwan University (NTU), Mandarin Training Center of National Taiwan Normal University (NTNU) and the Chinese Language Center of National Chengchi University (NCCU).

During these intensive Mandarin courses, I would share my experiences with you through email and Facebook. At the end, I would take and approve the TOCFL examination to verify and show what I have learned from these courses.

After My Proposal

·  I would like to share the knowledge of Mandarin Chinese to the foreign people and friends in Taiwan and East Asia, offering free language exchange with them.

·  I’d like to promote the knowledge of Mandarin in my community back home and introduce them this language and more about it, offering free Chinese courses and language exchange.

·  I want to offer free language exchange of Spanish and English to locals in Taiwan.

·  I wonder to be part of social and cultural projects where I can share and communicate my ideas and opinions with people from Taiwan and Asia, be able to make a good connection between different cultures, share as most as I can about my culture and experiences.

I want to delve into the East Asia culture, exploring and knowing in a deeper way this wonderful place. I look forward to gain deeper theoretical and practical knowledge starting and managing most innovative projects. I wonder to continue learning and growing throughout my entire life, learn from my mistakes, give respect, help others, express gratitude, forgive and apply ethical principles to make a significant difference. 

Thanks

I would like to thank you for your time and attention to my proposal.

story:
Help us make Brooklyn Literacy Roots a reality for NYC children this summer and for many summers to come!  We are three NYC teachers who created this unique camp a year ago in order to both promote the foundations of literacy and address the unequal access to enriching summer experiences that many NYC children face.  Last summer, we raised money from family and friends, found space in a Brooklyn independent school, and recruited children who we felt most needed the camp experience we had in mind.  We'd like to do it again, but need your help!  

Who are we?  NYC teachers.  Emily teaches first grade in Washington Heights, Rosie teaches kindergarten on the East Side of Manhattan, and Bill teaches first grade in Brooklyn.  We all teach in schools that reflect the diversity of children in NYC.  Last year, in anticipation of summer, we saw some children in our own classrooms getting ready for camps, travels abroad, trips to the library, and fun experiences with their families.  We also saw children who weren't signed up for camp, had no travel plans, and would likely spend little time reading and playing outdoors because of where they lived.  The stark difference between these children seemed unfair, which compelled us to start our unique camp - one unlike any camp you can find in the city.  Brooklyn Literacy Roots was designed to not only level the playing field in terms of access to fun (a lot of city parks camps do this well) but to also infuse reading and writing into every day of camp (many literacy camps and summer programs only target families who can pay for this kind of support).  

There is considerable research that shows that many children from low income backgrounds regress in learning over the summer months, a phenomenon commonly known as "summer slide". In fact, research suggests that as much as 80% of the achievement gap is due to summer slide  -- children from low income families typically lose two months of reading achievement over the summer, while their middle income peers make reading gains. At Brooklyn Literacy Roots, we believe every child can succeed and grow as a reader given the right tools and support.  Our intent is to provide those tools and support!

However, the gap is more than just a learning gap; it's also an opportunity gap.  Families with limited financial resource face huge challenges in finding engaging and experience-rich summer programs for their children.  Instead of playing outside, going to museums, going on trips, and engaging in projects, many children spend their summer inside watching T.V, and playing video games, while family members work tirelessly at one or more jobs trying to make ends meet.

Brooklyn Literacy Roots is a camp that addresses these inequities.  We provide children with a summer experience that is rich in reading, writing, art, trips, outdoor fun, and enrichment.  The camp is free for families with the most significant financial need with a sliding scale for families who can make some financial contribution to the costs of running the camp.  We give preference to families with significant financial need when enrolling children.  

Brooklyn Literacy Roots is a full-day summer-long experience for children from Kindergarten to 3rd grade. Our camp directly supports the development of literacy skills and provides enriching experiences designed to help children become successful at reading. We know that there may be challenges in gaining some families' interest in a summer literacy camp, as they may consider it a form of summer school.  However Brooklyn Literacy Roots integrates time for play, field trips, art, and exploration, as well as reading, making it a truly fun and rewarding experience.  

Take a look at the video included as part of this proposal.  Our kids have as much fun as kids attending any other summer camp.  What distinguishes us is that we integrate an hour or two of small group reading instruction each day.  Many of the children we serve feel unsuccessful at reading due to their struggle to gain the skills they need. We not only teach them to read, but also to love reading. We give our children the opportunity to see that reading is an experience that it is connected to their own lives and we help them be successful at it.

Why do we need your help?  In order to provide individualized instruction and support to our campers, we will employ five qualified educators, who will receive a de minimis stipend for their time. We also need funding to secure space in a local school, insure our camp, provide engaging and enriching trips and projects, and purchase instructional tools including books, writing journals, and word study games. 

We are very excited to launch our second year at Brooklyn Literacy Roots Camp and appreciate your support. Help spread the word by donating, sharing our page, and reading with a kid you know!  Thank you!

story:
Hi, we are a bunch of friends living in Dublin city and some of us have lost loved ones to cancer in recent months. These pretty tragic events have been lengthy roller coaster journeys but with the help of Hospice services we were able to rely on end of life care, support  and protection. At a time of pain and helplessness that was the biggest relief and gift as our time could be devoted to our loved ones and the memories that we could still create with them. Empowered with such gratitude we are now aiming at fundraising €3000 for the Laura Lynn Children's Hospice, which provides transitional care, home support, respite and end-of-life care for all children with life limiting conditions and their families. Any of your donations will go a long way in making the Hospice more accessible and in helping the pursuit of opening a second Hospice in Ireland.

 In our effort and to show our commitment we have decided to challenge ourselves with climbing the four highest peaks of Ireland and spice things up with a little competition between boys and girls, even though we all play for the same team!)  

What We Need & What You Get

Many have already joined our forces by sponsoring us with vouchers which we' ll be using as Perks. Those range between coffee and lunch vouchers to massage and holistic treatments, theater tickets and much more, there is literally something for everyone! 

Our indiegogo page is solely devoted to raising money for the Laura Lynn Children's Hospice.  Here's how your fundraising helps:

€1  funds for a child's oxygen mask

€30 funds a massage or therapy session for a child

€500 covers the cost of consultant pediatrician sessions for several children

€1,575 covers the cost of 2 days and nights respite for a child

€8.500 funds a specialized children's care cot bed 


    Risks & Challenges

    In order to meet our target of €3.000 euro we have organised a fundraising night consisting of a surprise screening in Central Dublin

    @ the Grand Social, 35 Liffey street, Dublin 1. 

    on 20th August

    @1930pm

     Entrance is free and there will be a raffle at the end. If  you wish to come along email us on polettin@gmail.com to book or you could donate a symbolic 5 euro on this page and we' ll consider that as a booking.

      Other Ways You Can Help


      • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign :)
      Or help the Laura Lynn Hospice directly by organizing your own Fundraiser, Volunteering by taking part in existing events ( check out the event calendar at Laura Lynn.ie ),Offer corporate support through sponsorship, Shop through the online shop at Laura Lynn.ie. Any form of help always counts:)

story:
The Cape Elizabeth High School Sailing Team is a hardworking and dedicated group of young sailors.  This year 4 of our sailors have qualified to attend the Atlantic Coast Championship in Norfolk, VA and 1 of our sailors has qualified to attend the Cressy Singlehanded Nationals in Norfolk, VA.  This is such an exciting time for the sailors and we are so very proud.  We would like to do everything possible in order to get these sailors to compete in these amazing regattas.  

Sailing has been so much more than an after school sport for this team.  They have developed skills that will stay with them beyond their high school years both on and off the water.  Through sailing they have learned to become leaders, problem solvers and strong critical thinkers.  Their commitment to the sport and each other is extraordinary.  

Traveling with this team is no small task;  air fare, accommodations, food, entry fees, etc..  While our school is very supportive of our team, they do not have the funds to help with our expenses.  We are reaching out to you to help us realize our goals.  Sailors and parents alike are doing their part to make this amazing opportunity a reality through bake sales, yard sales, fundraising at area restaurants and shops, and possible sponsorship.  

Currently the families of the 5 sailors will be responsible for the cost of these two events.  All monies raised will go directly to the overall cost of getting the teams to Norfolk.  Monies raised will be pooled collectively for the team.

Please consider making a donation as any amount will help.  Your contributions will help make this dream a reality for a group of extremely hardworking young sailors.  If you are unable to contribute, please consider sharing with others via email or Facebook.  The more people who know the more likely we are to reach our goal.

We thank you!

story:
What We're Doing:

Workers' Independent News has been broadcasting labor-focused news for more than 12 years. Every weekday, we produce a three-minute headline newscast that airs on roughly 150 radio stations across the country reaching approximately 1 million people.

We've seen the increase in inequality in the U.S., and we feel that people need news that speaks to their concerns. That's why we're expanding our coverage of low-wage work issues and preparing to launch a Spanish-language newscast in addition to our English one.

By contributing to this campaign, you can help us produce two newscasts dedicated to the issues facing low-wage workers, Raise the Wage News. Approximately 80 million people over age 20 earn minimum wage in the U.S. according to research from the Economic Policy Institute. Half of these workers are women, and nearly 40 percent of those earning minimum wage are at least 40 years old.

Raise the Wage News will keep people abreast of developments on workplace safety regulations, living wage campaigns, and a host of other issues. Your support will allow us to expand our current coverage and provide an alternative source of news that reflects working people's priorities.


How We'll Use What We Raise:

We are a union shop. Along with the funds that arrive through this crowdfunding campaign, we are also approaching major unions, foundations and other donors for support. The total cost of this project for a year is $244,000. We aim to raise the bulk of that elsewhere. For example, the AFL-CIO has already committed $25,000 in support for this project. With the funds we raise, we will hire:

  • a bilingual (Spanish/English) producer to produce the Spanish-language news program;
  • a half-time staff person to focus on expanding our radio network so that our stories will air on more stations;
  • a half-time staff person dedicated to distributing Raise the Wage News through social media;
  • stringers who can produce stories on location.
In the event that we don't meet our entire funding goal, we will use the funds we do raise to expand our current production. We will add more time to work currently being done on outreach and distribution, and we will invest more in stringers who can produce stories from different parts of the U.S.. For example, we have relationships with stringers in Los Angeles, Chicago, and New York.

Risks & Challenges

Our goal is substantial. We have support with sharing this campaign coming from a range of labor-focused and progressive organizations, but this doesn't guarantee success.

  • To face this challenge, we will continue outreaching to new audiences throughout the campaign as we work to maintain our momentum and to reach beyond our regular core of donors.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone can make a financial contribution. Even without donating, there are other ways you can support our work.

  • Ask your friends and community to donate and to spread the word about what we're doing. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Call the radio stations you listen to and ask them to carry our content.

Thank you for your support! With your help, we will expand our coverage of low-wage work issues and connect more people with the movement for living wages and safe working conditions.

 Workers' Independent News has been broadcasting labor-focused news for more than 12 years. Every weekday, we produce a three-minute headline newscast that airs on roughly 150 radio stations across the country reaching approximately 1 million people.
We've seen the increase in inequality in the U.S., and we feel that people need news that speaks to their concerns. That's why we're expanding our coverage of low-wage work issues and preparing to launch a Spanish-language newscast in addition to our English one. 
By contributing to this campaign, you can help us produce two newscasts dedicated to the issues facing low-wage workers, Raise the Wage News. Approximately 80 million people over age 20 earn minimum wage in the U.S. according to research from the Economic Policy Institute. Half of these workers are women, and nearly 40 percent of those earning minimum wage are at least 40 years old.Raise the Wage News will keep people abreast of developments on workplace safety regulations, living wage campaigns, and a host of other issues. Your support will allow us to expand our current coverage and provide an alternative source of news that reflects working people's priorities.     How We'll Use What We Raise:
 We are a union shop. Along with the funds that arrive through this crowdfunding campaign, we are also approaching major unions, foundations and other donors for support. The total cost of this project for a year is $244,000. We aim to raise the bulk of that elsewhere. For example, the AFL-CIO has already committed $25,000 in support for this project. With the funds we raise, we will hire:

a bilingual (Spanish/English) producer to produce the Spanish-language news program;
a half-time staff person to focus on expanding our radio network so that our stories will air on more stations;
a half-time staff person dedicated to distributing Raise the Wage News through social media;
stringers who can produce stories on location.
In the event that we don't meet our entire funding goal, we will use the funds we do raise to expand our current production. We will add more time to work currently being done on outreach and distribution, and we will invest more in stringers who can produce stories from different parts of the U.S.. For example, we have relationships with stringers in Los Angeles, Chicago, and New York.
  Risks & Challenges  Our goal is substantial. We have support with sharing this campaign coming from a range of labor-focused and progressive organizations, but this doesn't guarantee success. 
To face this challenge, we will continue outreaching to new audiences throughout the campaign as we work to maintain our momentum and to reach beyond our regular core of donors. 
    Other Ways You Can Help We recognize that not everyone can make a financial contribution. Even without donating, there are other ways you can support our work.  Ask your friends and community to donate and to spread the word about what we're doing. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Call the radio stations you listen to and ask them to carry our content. 


Thank you for your support! With your help, we will expand our coverage of low-wage work issues and connect more people with the movement for living wages and safe working conditions.

story:
Dear friends,


Shortly after beginning my first Japanese course at college, I knew that I wanted to study abroad in Japan. Since then, studying Japanese has become a daily activity for me, and my family can attest that I never miss an opportunity to share my enthusiasm for Japanese language and culture.

This fall I finally have the opportunity to immerse myself in Japanese when I go to Osaka for an intensive language program! Between studying my kanji and vocabulary, I’ve also taken a part-time job this summer in order to prepare for the high cost of living in Japan. However, according to the cost estimates I won’t be able to raise quite enough money with my job. That’s why I’m asking for some financial contributions through Indiegogo. I know that money’s tight, but I will appreciate any amount that you can donate to my trip!

Thank you!

-Lizzie

story:
Building a Better Future Today

Oliver Stone at the GCAS "Democracy Rising Workshop"-- Brooklyn, New York 

The world needs a progressive global network committed to addressing and proposing solutions to the most basic challenges of our time: Income inequality, education, strengthening democratic community and global projects, climate change, clean energy sourcing, access to healthy food & clean water, safe shelter, truthful information, health care access, debt relief, and harmonious, healthy economic growth. 

The Global Center for Advanced Studies (GCAS) is a non-profit education project founded four years ago by world leading intellectuals and activists to create a global education network that links people together from different cultures, countries, languages in order to create a new collective alternative to a world run by the elite few at the cost of the rest of us. 

Why you should fund us

  • We are totally independent and do not take funds from corporate sponsorships
  • We do not take funds from investors; indeed we have turned down offers to buy our school for millions of dollars
  • We do not take funds from major foundations (i.e., Mellon, Pew, Templeton etc.)

How your funds will be used

  • Scholarships for students in need ($2,500)
  • Scholarships for incarcerated students ($1,500)
  • Our E-Learning Internet Platform: Big Blue Button ($4,800)
  • The funds to start working on a film documenting the creative ways our school, GCAS is resisting "fake news"; corporate debt education; bringing about environmental awareness and solutions; creating clean energy innovations; struggling against income inequality; racism; and the rising tide of Neo-fascism ($2,500)
  • Media Platform and Free Internet Broadcast News Show by Intellectuals and Activists Covering Specific Struggles and Ways to Address them ($1,200)
  • Support for artists and writers ($2,500)

Total: $15,000

When bankers say, "There is no alternative." We say, "Yes there is."

 
By creating a global network that provides low-cost and free education we can together begin to reimagine and organize a different world based on truths, bold new visions, new innovations, and empowering democratic networks that stand-up and with courage to speak truth to power.
 

People like Oliver Stone, Pulitzer Prize and Golden Globe winners, Lewis Gordon, Antonio Negri, Alain Badiou, Luce Irigaray, Michael Hardt, Gayatri Chakravorty Spivak, Azfar Hussain, Tariq Ali; professors and intellectuals from Harvard, Yale, Duke, the London School of Economics, Oxford, Cambridge; and people from all over the world from such countries as Bangladesh, Brazil, Chile, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Nigeria, India, Russia, Eastern Europe, Canada, Cuba and Australia have come together to think and re-think collectively, democratically about how to build a world for a better today and tomorrow by harvesting new ideas, new economic practices, and new innovations.

Checkout our faculty and affiliate faculty members

We are calling on you to help build this needed global education network and to collectively say, "There is a better way to live together on this beautiful planet." So far we have reached over 1 million people from over 120 countries and we're only just begun.

 

Our Honorary President, Prof. Lewis Gordon

Read about what we have built and are building our alternative.

 

A short film about GCAS from Hollywood filmmaker, Ilya Abulkhanov.

Your support in building this global education network will help us reach more people who wouldn't otherwise have access to thinking and learning together with leading intellectuals and activists. We also learn from others who, with an Internet connection can teach us about their local struggles so we can build solidarity networks of support.

When you become a member for just $5 we will give a free membership to another person in the world who cannot afford it. Your gift will be doubled so you can give a membership to someone else in the world who is not economically able to give money but they are able to participate with their minds, hands, ideas and their time so we can build a global network with all people in solidarity.

In short, this fundraiser is about building a global solidarity network that helps us fund more projects, more researchers, and provide an even greater access to education. Your funds, for example, will help us create a new clean energy and life sustaining think-tank that will comprise leading experts and activists who can begin to implement strategies for a cleaner healthier plant.

 

Pulitzer Prize winning writer, Chris Hedges and Activist, Boris Franklin discuss the School to Prison Pipeline in the USA at the GCAS "Democracy Rising" workshop in New York.

We believe there is more than enough intellectual capacity to outthink our planet's challenges, to provide courage and confidence in each other to stand-up and speak truth to unjust power, to racism, economic inequality, and to change how the world functions economically and educationally. 

Recently GCAS helped found the first degree granting higher education institution in the world operated by intellectuals and activists that seeks to provide low-cost, high-quality BA, MA, and PhD programs in "Social and Political Thought"--GCAS-Research Institute, Ireland.

GCAS has held seminars and events at the Centre Pompidou, Paris, Havana, Cuba, Athens, Greece, Brooklyn, New York, Philadelphia, USA, Berlin, Germany, Maribor, Slovenia and next month in Santiago, Chile. With your help we can continue expanding and creating centers of empowerment in new countries in which proposals and research can be formulated and published and new life can be giving through a progressive network.

Nelson Mandela once said, “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” What the elite few do not want us to do is to question how the world functions today in a manner that offers and proposes solutions. We propose them--we create them.

Distinguished Professor at Harvard University says: "This Global Center for Advanced Studies is what many of us, languishing in established academic institutions, have dreamed of for many years. I will seize the opportunity to show how the intellectual life can be engaged in the life of the world, how scholarship can escape the sclerotic and alienated language it passes off as edifying, and how critical thought can develop new forms of writing that speak to those outside of the academy and to those inside it who have been waiting, like pupae, for spring." --Professor Michael Jackson

Khanyile Mlotshwa (Zimbabwe) "GCAS has given me access to an amazing education and conversation that links up Africa to Europe and North American. This is the future of education" 

Hekatherina Clara Delgado (Uruguay) "I'm a street artist and performer and GCAS has been a lifeline for me to connect up my work with other struggles around the world."

Other GCAS Resources

GCAS E-School provides education to anyone in the world.

In addition to teaching on-line and in selected locations around the world, we also provide a free public news program, Interventions. We have a peer reviewed open-access and free journal, "Engaged Studies in Humanities and Social Sciences" via GCAS-RII. 

Be part of building a true alternative. We are not THE solution, but we do our part to create one.

A video from the founder and director of GCAS, Dr. Creston Davis

 

Join us--Let's Create a Better World Together

story:
Short Summary

A little bit about me:

  • I'm sixteen, but I am part of a residential high school that focuses on Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics. We reside on a university campus and take the university's  courses. For all intents and purposes, I am a college student. I am a farm girl, so I love animals and gardening. I love baking, debating American history, horseback riding, and singing.
  • As a teenager, it's rare to have an opportunity to travel abroad. In Harlaxton, I will be taking a month long English course that counts for 3 credit hours. We will be travelling to where great authors such as Shakespeare, Emily Bronte, and J. K. Rowling wrote their masterpieces.
  • Your contributions will be help me with an opportunity that I otherwise would be unable to afford. It will also be counting towards both my high school diploma and undergraduate degree.

Needs & Benefits

What I need:

  • Total of approximately $3000
  • $2750 covers travelling expenses and the course cost.
  • $150 for the application fee.
  • Anything over will go towards spending money (recommended is $600).

What you get:

  • All contributors will receive some photos of the trip to England.
  • Thank You Video: I will send you a video personally thanking you and expressing my gratitude for your contribution.
  • Cookies: I will send you my family recipe chocolate chip cookies that have won several 4-H first place awards.
  • Handmade Pillow: I will sew a horse print couch pillow, because I love horses and would love to share my sewing abilities with you.
  • Painting and Cupcakes: I will paint a botanical scene on canvas, because I love flowers and bright paintings. The cupcakes will be your choice of chocolate or vanilla with buttercream icing.

If the goal isn't reached:

  • If the goal isn't reached, the funds will be put towards the cost of trip. Any amount counts!

The Impact

This project not only benefits me, but my hometown as well.

  • I've made a commitment to encourage the less fortunate students in my hometown to pursue higher education and world knowledge. In the 2014-2015 school year, I will be counselling teenagers and helping them explore the resources at their disposal. Hopefully this will increase the number of college graduates in my Kentucky county.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, I would greatly appreciate you sharing my campaign with the people in your life. Thank you so very much for taking the time to read through my campaign.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Isabel Beeman, and I have been selected to participate in a course that involves a two week trip to South Africa. My parents have agreed to pay for half of the costs, but I am in charge of raising the remaining funds. That is the purpose of this site!
  • This course is something that I have wanted to do from the minute I heard about it. It not only consists of the life changing two weeks in South Africa, but a semester long course that delves into the history of the country, and ties it to that of our own.
  • Going on this trip (and taking this course) will help to equip me with the knowledge and experience that I need to make a difference in the world. This trip is not meant to be a vacation, but rather a learning experience, that I will use to cultivate a better understanding of an entirely different culture. With this new information, I would hope to be able to help countries like South Africa achieve their goals and continue to progress as nations in the future.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The trip's total cost is $4,500, and my parents have said that I need to raise a minimum of $2,000 on my own. The money will be going to my school, who will be organizing the class and the trip. 
  • Some perks that I've added include sketches and babysitting. Drawing is one of my passions, and if I could use it as a way to raise money, I would be very grateful.  A few examples of my art are shown below:

Also, I've been babysitting for years, and I love kids. Watching children is something I do regularly anyway, so if anyone needs it, that would be really great!

  • If my goal of $2,000 is not met entirely with the funds from this website, I will hopefully still be participating in the course, for I will also be working to earn money elsewhere. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't donate, telling other people about this would be very helpful to me! This course is something that I'm looking forward to so much, and any sort of contribution is greatly appreciated, no matter how small. Thank you!
