story:
We've all heard the stories of Rwanda.  Stories of pain and suffering, loss and death.  Stories that have touched our hearts and drawn us in, calling us to action with the hope of making a small difference in the life of another.  The genocide of 1994 was a mark in history that will never be forgotten.  With almost 20 years behind them, the scars of war are slowly being healed and a new story is emerging. 

 

Girls in Rwanda have a longing to be educated.  Yet many drop out before graduating high school because of poverty, a lack of parental support and household chores taking priority over schoolwork.  So the age-old question remains... WHAT CAN WE DO?

Now 14 years old, Ellie has been hearing stories about Rwanda since the age of 10 and the challenges many girls face to complete their education.  Understanding the importance of her own education, Ellie wanted to give the same opportunity she had to other girls in Rwanda by helping them to finish their studies.

In 2012, her love for running and her love for Rwanda became one.  With the help of friends and family, Ellie organized the very first RUN FOR RWANDA in honor of Gloria, a student she chose to sponsor last year.  Her goal was to raise $1200, the yearly cost for one student to attend Rwamagana Lutheran School and instead raised over $2000!

This year, as a new board member of Rwanda School Project and continuing sponsor to Gloria, it is Ellie's goal to raise $2600.  This will support Gloria for another year of school along with a second girl in need of financial assistance!

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Participate in the RUN FOR RWANDA!

July 21 - 2:00-4:00pm

Maria Carillo High School

6975 Montecito Blvd  Santa Rosa, California 95409 (Look for us on the track!)

$30 Entry Fee for runners with T-shirt included! All donations welcome online or at the track.  Music, water and healthy snacks available to all participants.

Founder of Rwanda School Project and Principal of Rwamagana Lutheran School, ROBIN STRICKLER, will also be in attendance! 

 

Can't make the run?  Join us online and donate to a worthy cause!

$20 could buy school supplies for one student

$50 could buy two sets of school uniforms for one student

$100 could support one student for one month of school

$600 could support one student with a partial scholarship for an entire year (reserved for students whose parents only have the means to pay half tuition)

$1200 could support one student with a full scholarship for an entire year (reserved for students who are orphaned, living in extreme poverty or merit-based)

  

THANK YOU FOR BEING PART OF THE CHANGE AND BELIEVING IN THE IMPORTANCE OF EDUCATION FOR GIRLS!!

 

Click below to like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on our website!

story:
Short Summary

I have developed an analysis project that will study the results of one particular non-governmental organization — an NGO by the name of THE CHILDREN’S MEDICAL CARE FOUNDATION, which aids Eastern European children — and through my analysis enable Children’s Medical Care Foundation to determine which of the Foundation's efforts are using their tight resources on the best means possible to help the children under their care. The money donated here will fund my 3-month, on-location, fact-gathering project in Poland and the Ukraine.

The Full Story

As the mother of a happy and energetic 19 month old, like most mothers my child’s health and well-being are always at the forefront of my mind. I find comfort in knowing that in case of sickness or possible emergency my child has access to proper and modern health care. 

My child is one of the lucky ones. Sadly not all mothers can share in the comfort of knowing proper health care is available for their infants and children. Even with new technological advancements, the health care of children remains inadequate in many parts of the world.

This is the sad reality in some Eastern European nations, including Poland, the Ukraine and Latvia.  Being of Polish descent my heart feels especially tied to those children, and I am determined to help them. It is my intent to be a voice for these children.

I have developed an analysis project that will study the results of one particular NGO — the CHILDREN’S MEDICAL CARE FOUNDATION — and through my analyses enable them to determine which of the Foundation’s efforts are using their tight resources on the best means possible to help the children under their care.

For three decades The Children’s Medical Care Foundation has been at the forefront of the ongoing battle to preserve the life and health of ailing infants and children. This organization’s efforts in sharing vital, up-to-date medical knowledge with training for pediatricians and specialists from Poland, Ukraine and Latvia has resulted in a sharp reduction of infant deaths, most notably in Poland.

As a single mother and full-time student at Claremont Graduate University working towards two Masters degrees, I am struggling to make ends meet. Any contributions provided will be used for travel expenses, food and lodging, research materials, and any other fees acquired related to the research project. I hope that you will share in my passion for helping the next generation of Eastern European children receive the best medical care available by supporting my summer research of The Children’s Medical Care Foundation, an organization that strives to makes this possible.

The Impact

As the first person to assess the Foundation’s effectiveness in helping children, I am traveling to Poland and the Ukraine for three months this summer to conduct data-gathering research in the form of personal observation, interviews and surveys. Upon collection I will publish this data, and provide the public and The Children’s Medical Care Foundation with as thorough an analysis as possible, so that the Foundation’s activity can thrive and expand its efforts on behalf of children for future decades.

I feel extremely compelled to help the Foundation, through this research project,  to build on its strengths, improve weaknesses, and adapt to the evolving and chronic health care threats in infants and children in Eastern Europe.

Why? Because healthcare is a basic fundamental human right, access to the best medical care should never be denied to infants and children. 

Every child deserves a chance at life, the fulfillment of their dreams, and realization of true potentials. Sick and weak children cannot grow into those who will build strong societies. The active and continuous progress of The Children’s Medical Care Foundation is fundamental to this goal for infants and children in Poland, the Ukraine, and Latvia.

Ways You Can Help

I am hoping for your contribution, but even if you can't donate money, you can still help me help the kids:

  • Tell everyone about my campaign to help The Children's Medical Care Foundation.
  • Please use the IndieGoGo SHARE share tool to send others to my fundraising campaign.
  • THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS & EFFORTS!

I have developed an analysis project that will study the results of one particular NGO — the CHILDREN’S MEDICAL CARE FOUNDATION — and through my analyses enable them to determine which of the Foundation’s efforts are using their tight resources on the best means possible to help the children under their care.
For three decades The Children’s Medical Care Foundation has been at the forefront of the ongoing battle to preserve the life and health of ailing infants and children. This organization’s efforts in sharing vital, up-to-date medical knowledge with training for pediatricians and specialists from Poland, Ukraine and Latvia has resulted in a sharp reduction of infant deaths, most notably in Poland.
As a single mother and full-time student at Claremont Graduate University working towards two Masters degrees, I am struggling to make ends meet. Any contributions provided will be used for travel expenses, food and lodging, research materials, and any other fees acquired related to the research project. I hope that you will share in my passion for helping the next generation of Eastern European children receive the best medical care available by supporting my summer research of The Children’s Medical Care Foundation, an organization that strives to makes this possible.


The Impact
As the first person to assess the Foundation’s effectiveness in helping children, I am traveling to Poland and the Ukraine for three months this summer to conduct data-gathering research in the form of personal observation, interviews and surveys. Upon collection I will publish this data, and provide the public and The Children’s Medical Care Foundation with as thorough an analysis as possible, so that the Foundation’s activity can thrive and expand its efforts on behalf of children for future decades.
I feel extremely compelled to help the Foundation, through this research project,  to build on its strengths, improve weaknesses, and adapt to the evolving and chronic health care threats in infants and children in Eastern Europe.
Why? Because healthcare is a basic fundamental human right, access to the best medical care should never be denied to infants and children. 
Every child deserves a chance at life, the fulfillment of their dreams, and realization of true potentials. Sick and weak children cannot grow into those who will build strong societies. The active and continuous progress of The Children’s Medical Care Foundation is fundamental to this goal for infants and children in Poland, the Ukraine, and Latvia.


Ways You Can Help
I am hoping for your contribution, but even if you can't donate money, you can still help me help the kids:

Tell everyone about my campaign to help The Children's Medical Care Foundation.
Please use the IndieGoGo SHARE share tool to send others to my fundraising campaign.
THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS & EFFORTS!

story:
DATE OF EVENT: JUNE 16TH, 2012

TIME OF EVENT: 2:00pm

PLACE OF EVENT: The West Steps of the State Capitol.

Slutwalk Sacramento is apart of an international grassroots movement aimed to combat rape culture and to promote sexual empowerment. It erupted after a Toronto Police officer (2011) stated during a York University forum on safety: Women should avoid dressing like SLUTS in order not to get [sexually] victimized.

1 out of every 6 American women has been the victim of an attempted or completed rape in her lifetime; 1 in 33 American men have experienced an attempted or completed rape in his lifetime, and only 6% of rapists will ever spend a day in jail (RAIIN). Criminalizing the innocent is one of the primary reasons 15 out of 16 rapists walk away freely without penalty (Rape, abuse, and incest national network). According to Jaclyn Friedman a huge majority of rapes are perpetrated by a small minority of guys who do it again and again. They rape an average of 6 times each, and continue to do so, because we let them. Because as a culture we give them a "social license to operate." Because we turn around and say "she shouldnt have put herself in that situation." Why was she walking by herself at night? Why did she wear a G-string and short skirt? She was playing hard to get. She told me no, but her body said yes. Shes a SLUT. Women of color don't want to be made love to, they just like to get F*CKED. He/She is a hooker-it doesnt count. He didn't get raped, he's gay...Boys will be boys... The more and more we perpetuate these SOCIAL MYTHS and STIGMAS, the more we are creating a world with more rapists for all of us to live in. When someone becomes a victim of sexual violence theyve been robbed to the right to their own body. Rape & sexual assault are violations of human rights. Sexual assault is not a sexual expression. Rape is not engagement in sexual activity. It is violence, and it motivated by power and control. It is about fear, shame and humiliation. NO where in between is it about sexual gratification.

It is damn scary when we live in a world where our institutions perpetuate rationalizing inexcusable behavior, and create environments in which it is okay to blame the victim. It is tragic when survivors of sexual assault are less secure to report a crime to the police, due to fear that they could be blamed for their own assault, or face even more tragic consequences (ie deportation, jail time, etc). Sexual assault is an extremely under reported crime as is.

Being charge of our sexual lives should not mean that we are opening ourselves to an expectation of violence. No one should equate enjoying sex, or seemingly appearing to want it, with attracting sexual assault.
We are a movement demanding that our voices be heard. We are here to medicate this cultural illness, this social disease, that gives rapists a social license to operate.

What We Need

    • PA System - $129.30
    • Porta potties - $350
    • PA Delivery - $150
    • Marching Permit - $75
    • Tables and Chairs (I did an estimate of 10 tables and 20 chairs, but we could have less, I don't know since we are all getting the co-sponsors together) - $91 w/ free delivery
    • PVC Pipe - $5.98
    • Concrete - $2.69
    • Rope - $1.00
    • Lanyards & Vests for Volunteers - $40.00

    Total of $844.97 currently.

  • THIS AMOUNT DOES NOT INCLUDE FLYER COSTS, SIGN MAKING COSTS, ETC.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Volunteer!
  • Attend the event!
  • Tell your friends!

story:
Namaste,

No matter where we live, we can bring a change in anyone's life. There are still thousands of girls in Indian brothels from Nepal. Some of them were sold just for $500. I think its root cause is the lack of education. We have our responsibilities to the community. Please help me to send at least 10 girls to school in Nepal. The collected funds will be provided to those underprivileged girls who are deserving to be in the schools. This is just an initiation and I hope to get your supports for this cause. As we proceed further, we would be publishing the names and address of those girls who will be funded.

Thank you.

story:
About the Oaksterdam University Veterans Freedom Fighter Scholarship Fund

Cannabis has been shown to be helpful in reintegrating veterans into civilian life after traumatic brain injury, neuropathic pain and PTSD, or simply as a harm reduction technique safer than alcohol and many Rx drugs.  We believe it is unpatriotic to deny these heroes the very medication that helps them, and then criminalize it.  Oaksterdam University is launching the Veterans Freedom Fighter Scholarship Fund as Post-traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Reaches Epidemic Proportions.  The men and women who serve in the United States military deserve the honor, respect and thanks of a grateful nation. While no single act can truly thank those who served, we can provide them with education leading to better quality of life and opportunity here at home.  

We are raising money to cover our small tuition fee for these veterans.  We are turning to crowd-sourced funding because we believe a small investment in a brave soul returning home can completely alter the rest of their lives for the better.

Dale Sky Jones, Oaksterdam University’s Executive Chancellor, announced the formation of the Veterans Freedom Fighter Scholarship Fund on Veterans' Day.  The private fund will help to fulfill this promise with financial aid options to help over 100 returning veterans to define their own success at home, by preparing them to succeed with Oaksterdam University's multifaceted curriculum.  Private contributions are needed for Veterans, who will be taught how to be safe and responsible under state law, develop skills for successful law enforcement encounters, take control of their medication and find employment.

“Viet Nam vets have shown me that, in many cases, cannabis is the one medicine that has consistently helped their seriously disabling symptoms, allowing them to function, hold jobs, keep their relationships intact, and raise families for the past 30 or so years, when years of therapy and numerous meds have not,” explains Frank H. Lucido, MD in Berkeley, CA.

How It Works & Why It's Needed

Current US Marijuana Policy Denies Vital Benefits to Veterans.  Marijuana possession of less than an ounce may result in dishonorable discharge, forfeiture of all pay, and confinement for 2 years.  All branches of the military take a zero tolerance approach to marijuana and vigorously prosecute offenders.  If a soldier tests positive, they are likely to face significant punishment, including a court-martial or other administrative action that is likely to result in the termination of their career.  

Negative military service characterizations carry significant consequences. Eligibility for VA benefits, including GI Bill and home loan guarantees, can be restricted and in many cases barred. In addition, a veteran might be disqualified from federal, state and local government employment. The ability to obtain student aid, scholarships, and admission to higher education institutions might be impacted. It may affect the ability to obtain licenses and certifications needed for professional employment, as well as obtaining credit and loans in connection with establishing a business. Civilian employers consider military service characterization when deciding whether or not to hire.

A recent Drug Policy Alliance Report illustrates roughly 30 percent of veterans from Iraq and Afghanistan report symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), traumatic brain injury, depression, mental illness or other cognitive disability, making integration back into civilian life even more difficult.  Veterans suffering from PTSD often have negative law enforcement encounters.  Left untreated, these medical conditions often contribute to substance abuse, fatal overdose, homelessness and suicide, as well as violations of the law, particularly nonviolent drug offenses. 

The statistics are alarming: about 18 veterans take their lives each day. In fact, suicide is now the leading cause of death in the army, with more soldiers dying by suicide than in combat.  Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) among American soldiers returning from Iraq and Afghanistan has reached epidemic proportions, affecting between 75,000 to 225,000 veterans.  The use of cannabis and cannabinoids likely mitigates symptoms associated with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), according to a review of clinical and preclinical evidence published online in the scientific journal Drug Testing and Analysis.  The study concluded, “Cannabis might make it easier for people with PTSD to rest or sleep and to feel less anxious and less involved with flashback memories.  Evidence is increasingly accumulating that cannabinoids might play a role in fear extinction and anti-depressive effects. It is concluded that further studies are warranted in order to evaluate the therapeutic potential of cannabinoids in PTSD.”

The application process will begin online at www.oaksterdamuniversity.com in January 2013 for Veterans interested in receiving Freedom Fighter Scholarship benefits.  The more we raise the more Vets we can educate. America’s first cannabis college was founded in 2007 to provide students with the highest quality training for the cannabis industry.  Since opening its doors, over 15,000 have gained important skills for success.  Oaksterdam University is currently offering 25% off tuition for any US Veteran enroll in 2012 and is participating with RecruitMilitary, the leading national Opportunity Expo for Veterans seeking job placement.

Fund recipients will be selected through self-nomination and Veteran's organizations submissions beginning in January 2013.  The screening process is aided by Not This Time Vets (NTTV) and Veterans for Medical Marijuana Access (VMMA).  Upon graduation from the Basic Program or Semester Course from Oaksterdam University, NTTV will assist in job placement.  

What We Need

Our goal is $35,000 to start over one hundred veterans on the path for higher education, and a better quality of life.  We apply every dollar to tuition for the education of veterans, even if we do not reach our full goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the story of Oaksterdam University with all your friends and colleagues! Share this link on Facebook and Twitter.  The more we spread the word, the better chance we have of reaching our goal to save a seat in class for a Veteran.

story:
Help us send TEN outstanding youth to Washington, D.C.


National Organizations for Youth Safety (NOYS), in partnership with AT&T and Operation Lifesavers, Inc., is holding the third annual national Teen Distracted Driving Prevention Summit in Washington, D.C. from December 1st-3rd.  Reynolds' Right Hands will be selecting up to ten high school students from Florida to attend the summit.  

 

Why is this important?


On November 15, 2009, Christy Reynolds, a teacher at a local Central Florida high school, was killed in a car crash.  The offending driver claimed to be using a phone behind the wheel, preventing the driver from seeing the red light she was about to run.  Christy, in the car with her daughter, sister, and nephew, were all in the car as the driver ran the red light and hit them.  

 

What can youth do?

We believe the youth of this country have the ability to make the biggest impact, both on our roads and in our communities.  Students from Central Florida have been learning more and more the deadly message about distracted driving.  By engaging youth in the process, they are empowered to make a difference in their schools, communities, and all throughout Florida.

 

What's the cost?

Traveling isn't cheap!  Reynolds' Right Hands is ambitiously raising funds to do more and more with students throughout the state to make a larger impact.  It will cost about $400 per student to travel for the three day event.

 

What is Reynolds' Right Hands?

Reynolds' Right Hands is a startup nonprofit organization started by youth after the death of their beloved teacher, Ms. Christy Reynolds.  Starting as a grassroots movement in their school, Reynolds' Right Hands has grown to be an incorporated nonprofit organization in the State of Florida, pursuing its 501(c)3 tax-exempt status within the year, and most importantly, actively and directly working with high school students to form much larger, widescale campaigns.  Reynolds' Right Hands mission is to reduce traffic fatalities on Florida's roads by promoting awareness and actively engaging students in their awareness and prevention campaign.  Hosting numerous events, rallies, and creating much-needed resources for youth, Reynolds' Right Hands is an advocate for youth throughout the United States.  Their message is simple - TTYL I'm Driving

story:
Short Summary

Getaboard is a 501c3 non-profit organization that teaches homeless, under privileged and at-risk youth how to surf, skateboard and do art. We have found that according to a 2009 Harvard Graduate School of Education report, extracurricular activities, such as skateboarding and art:

  • Increases a child's academic performance and school attendance
  • Decreases a child's chance of involvement in drugs and juvenile delinquency

In such desperate times, providing quality, engaging activities and solid role models has never been of greater importance to our youth and our country. A recent CBS 60 MINUTES Special, Hard Times Generation, stated Florida has the third largest homeless population in the United States and growing. There are over 10,000 homeless children living in central Florida, alone.

 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rs5--QZ98Fk

This scenario combined with a recent report from Psychology Today's Teen Angst segment stating that homeless youth are 50% more likely than average students to drop out of high school due to unstable home lives, potential domestic violence and food scarcity creates a looming concern. Each high school drop-out costs our society $340,000.00 over their lifetime, due to their dependence on housing, food, and medical care. Also, 82% of all prisoners incarcerated in America, today, are high school dropouts.

We can see the problem. So let's work on the solution and break the cycle!

For the past 2 years the Getaboard Foundation has been working with the Coalition for the Homeless, providing our Getaboard Skateboarding program which helps homeless children, going through a turbulent time in their lives, learn how to properly skateboard and do art in exchange for taking our Life Target Test. This simple test, helps these kids discover a career that best fits their personality type while planting a seed of hope and a positive self image of themselves to carry into the future. A child with a dream can overcome any obstacle.

Our Getaboard Skateboarding program offers our students a chance to:

  • Use quality skateboards, safety gear and equipment
  • Be instructed by knowledgeable, pre-screened, volunteer skateboarding and art instructors
  • Build self esteem and a positive self image through newly acquired skills and a new found sense of self awareness

At the end of each six week session, during our Getaboard Board Awards, each child is rewarded their own skateboard, helmet and Getaboard tee shirt for passing our program.

Our goal is to positively impact the lives of over 250 homeless children through our Getaboard Skateboarding program in 2013. Each child's "Board Award" costs approximately $50 per child to reward them with their own skateboard, helmet, and Getaboard tee shirt. Additional expenses are food, snacks, water and transportation costs needed each week to provide skate lessons.

If we are unable to reach our goal of impacting the lives of 250 kids through our fundraising efforts or even if we surpass our goal, we will adjust our program to reach the maximum amount of children we are able to serve by $50 increments.

The Impact

By requiring that each children earn their Getaboard "Board Award" by taking our Life Target Test and passing our six week skateboarding program, Getaboard:

  • Builds the value of the gift in each child's mind
  • Teaches them to set goals and work hard for things they desire
  • Allows them to label themselves as something other than homeless- they are now a skateboarder or an artist
  • Plants a seed of hope in each child's heart for a brighter future beyond their current circumstances of being homeless

If we can help each of these 250 homeless children in 2013 aspire to at least graduate high school and possibly have a vision of a future career, we will not only be helping to breaking the cycle of financial heartache in their family, but helping ease the potential negative financial impact on society by approximately $85,000,000.00- All by helping this small group of children through skateboarding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not an Anberlin fan (then something's wrong with you, cuz they rock!) you can still help Getaboard impact the lives of these most deserving of under privileged youth by doing the following:

  • Helping us get the word out about what we do, to people you know who surf, skate, create or who love helping kids or the future of our country, in general.
  • Join us on Facebook and hopefully "LIKE US" to find out about other Indiegogo campaigns and cool fundraisers we will be conducting in the near      future with plenty of swag and goodies for all. Go to: www.facebook.com/getaboardkids
  • Blast this particular campaign out to all your homies who hopefully also love Anberlin and would love to enter to win a super sick Epiphone one-of-a-kind Anberlin Signed Guitar and get a gnarly Getaboard T-shirt for their effort! You know they'll be stoked- so Blast it- www.indiegog.com/homelesschildrenskateboarding     

Thank you for helping positively impact the lives of homeless youth through action sports and art! Getaboard!

At the end of each six week session, during our Getaboard Board Awards, each child is rewarded their own skateboard, helmet and Getaboard tee shirt for passing our program.
Our goal is to positively impact the lives of over 250 homeless children through our Getaboard Skateboarding program in 2013. Each child's "Board Award" costs approximately $50 per child to reward them with their own skateboard, helmet, and Getaboard tee shirt. Additional expenses are food, snacks, water and transportation costs needed each week to provide skate lessons.
If we are unable to reach our goal of impacting the lives of 250 kids through our fundraising efforts or even if we surpass our goal, we will adjust our program to reach the maximum amount of children we are able to serve by $50 increments.
The Impact
By requiring that each children earn their Getaboard "Board Award" by taking our Life Target Test and passing our six week skateboarding program, Getaboard:

Builds the value of the gift in each child's mind
Teaches them to set goals and work hard for things they desire
Allows them to label themselves as something other than homeless- they are now a skateboarder or an artist
Plants a seed of hope in each child's heart for a brighter future beyond their current circumstances of being homeless
If we can help each of these 250 homeless children in 2013 aspire to at least graduate high school and possibly have a vision of a future career, we will not only be helping to breaking the cycle of financial heartache in their family, but helping ease the potential negative financial impact on society by approximately $85,000,000.00- All by helping this small group of children through skateboarding.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not an Anberlin fan (then something's wrong with you, cuz they rock!) you can still help Getaboard impact the lives of these most deserving of under privileged youth by doing the following:

Helping us get the word out about what we do, to people you know who surf, skate, create or who love helping kids or the future of our country, in general.
Join us on Facebook and hopefully "LIKE US" to find out about other Indiegogo campaigns and cool fundraisers we will be conducting in the near      future with plenty of swag and goodies for all. Go to: www.facebook.com/getaboardkids

Blast this particular campaign out to all your homies who hopefully also love Anberlin and would love to enter to win a super sick Epiphone one-of-a-kind Anberlin Signed Guitar and get a gnarly Getaboard T-shirt for their effort! You know they'll be stoked- so Blast it- www.indiegog.com/homelesschildrenskateboarding     
Thank you for helping positively impact the lives of homeless youth through action sports and art! Getaboard!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Liz Frank and I own Nob Hill Fabrics in Albuquerque, New Mexico.  A small, independent fabric store, we sell specialty and hard-to-find fabrics unavailable elsewhere in town.  We also offer sewing classes to teach the skills that bring designer dreams to life.


Our challenge at the moment is to teach pants making.  A properly fitted pair of pants sits comfortably at the waist and falls smoothly over the hips and thighs while standing, sitting and walking.` A pair of pants meeting all these requirements is worth its weight in gold and is as hard to find as that lost dryer sock.

Luckily, sewing is not the lost art it has been portrayed in the media.  Many of us still retain the skills we learned in junior high and are happy and willing to pass them on to the younger generation, with the exception of pants making.  Too few of today's home sewers have mastered the art of fitting and constructing the perfect pair of trousers, but help is available.  Seamstress Linda Lee has not only tamed the monster that is the construction and fitting of a fine pair of slacks, but is a well-known and respected teacher of said skill.

We would like to bring this sewing and teaching goddess from the far reaches of Kansas City to the wild west of Albuquerque for a two-day pants fitting and construction workshop.  While her costs are reasonable, they are also prohibitive for many potential students and we would like to subsidize the event to lower their cost.

This is where you come in.  Your donation will go to Linda's teaching fee and travel costs bringing it down from $250 to $150 per student.  In addition, you will also contribute to the first and foremost pants ingredients -- fine fabrics.  Our shelves will burst at the seams with linens, wools, gabardines, rayon crepes and yes, fine silk suitings to supply the class as well as future production.

Sewing is a basic life skill and should not be lost to future generations.  We have taught beginners to thread and use a sewing machine and intermediate sewers have taken their skills to new levels with fitting and other technique classes.  Our bra-making, tailored jacket and pattern adjusting classes are especially popular as they fill a void in Albuquerque.

For more information about the Nob Hill Fabrics go to:
                     http://nobhillfabrics.com/

and more information about the pants workshop can be found at:

                    http://www.nobhillfabrics.com/classes/LindaLee....

For more about Linda and The Sewing Workshop, go to:

                      http://sewingworkshop.com/

    

Spread the word!!!  If you can't contribute you must know someone who can.  Try to find someone generous :-).

story:
Please Ask judge Morgenstern why She illegally and Unlawfully stole my 4 year old son Howwee away from me?

                

                                 Help Turn My Pain into POWER!

Please help me get Howwee home and complete the HEAL Center.

I need your help to turn my pain into Power.

Hello my name is Aleah Holland known to thousand as Miss HEAL. I'm 9 months pregnant. I'm a registered nurse for 15 years. I am also the founder of HEAL Network Inc, a  youth organization that provides free services to seniors and create programs for underprivileged youth to keep them off them safe and off the streets. These programs were funded entirely from my savings and my salary as a nurse. We receive mostly product and service donations. I recently put all my money in a Headquarters for HEAL Network Inc. as we were getting kicked out, and bounced all around when we borrowed, and even rented spaces in the schools we serviced. I did not know what happened to me would ever happen

Miss HEAL WILL BE ARRESTED!

 

August 15, 2012  I had my youngest child stolen away from me. My child was stolen by a ruthless, corrupt domestic violence judge. She gave full custody to my abuser and if I contact my son I WILL BE ARRESTED!

I left my abuser/batter in 2009. At a custody exchange on Christmas 2010 he attacked me.

I entered Domestic violence court after being attacked again.

I thought in domestic violence court I was SAFE

Guns, Drugs, violence, Abuse is okay- That is what judge and children lawyer say.

I complained about the guns, abuse, drug use, uncommon sense, endangering the life of my children, using my child to drain taxpayers for a case that was simple, but has carried on for almost 3 years.

After that this judge had no problems proving me right. That she had it out for me.  Genevieve the children's lawyer from the children Law Center allowed my child to be burned, guns pulled out around him, drug use, abuse, and has not done one thing to protect him. She has endangered the life of my child as well. She should never be allowed to practice law especially as a child attorney.

I have been prevented from protecting my child.

December 12, 2012: judge states she does not care if I lose my job. 1st time since 2009 abuser is ever drug tested. I give an audio of 12 year old reporting guns, drugs and violence at abusers home.

December 22, 2012,: Son is stolen away from me after I give an audio of 12 year old reporting guns, drugs and violence at abusers home. Son is stolen away while my daughter and friends watch in horror.

Genevieve child's lawyer states she feel the 3 year old is more credible when he say mommy plays with guns and not the 12 year old who reported the incident. She allows my son to be turned over to the abuser who tested positive for illegal drugs and alcohol that same day.

January 2012:

1. I am interviewed by Brooklyn News 12 but story not aired-they said due to the courts being closed they can not verify my story.

2. I file a judicial complaint and many other complaints

January 5, 2012: my son is given back to me.

February 2012:  court date postponed,

March 2012 : court date postponed.

April 18, 2012: After losing job due to the biweekly court dates I am denied legal counsel.

Judge is rude and condescending. Judge repeats something I wrote on Twitter. "She is following me on twitter"

May 9,2012: Denied legal counsel again, and after ABUSER is testing positive EVERY DAY for ILLEGAL DRUGS and ALCOHOL judge reduces testing from daily testing to RANDOM-Testing which turns out to be NOT AT ALL. even after I state my child LIFE is being endangered when he is high and drunk.

  • Genevieve Howwee's lawyer nonchalantly states he is witnessing drugs like weed, and needle use, and that’s it. NOTHING.

June 27, 2012 ABUSER is arrested for beating and attacking my 15 year old daughter while she holds her 4 year old brother in her arms.

September 2012 Only After Recovering Transcripts I Learn

 

My Abuser Can KILL ME and He is protected by her laws.

July 18, 2012 -I tell court after 3 hours waiting I am having a pregnancy emergency. Judge holds a fake trial without my presence, only my Abuser is there. He creates a fake story and judge files numerous false charges against me; Unbeknownst to me while I was in the hospital having a possible miscarriage; She switch the ABUSER court case for attacking the children from CRIMINAL COURT and places in her court.-where it does not belong.

August 6, 2012: She put a warrant out for my arrest after holding another secret hearing

August 15, 2012 notified by daycare owner there is a warrant for my arrest and that I lost all contact with my child.

August 21, 2012 different judge vacated the warrant, but did not give me my son back.

September 28, 2012- I filed a lawsuit against the judge and other crooked, corrupt officials.

Holland vs Morgenstern- link below

https://www.google.com/search?q=holland+vs+morg...

October 18, 2012 she will not take herself off my case, after falsifying documents, fabricating lies. She chooses to ignore factual evidence, and tamper with, other evidence to create false cases. She obstructs justice, retaliates, manufactures malicious false facts or ignores others, allows infirm claims or dismisses valid ones, denies admission of evidence prejudicial to the favored party, she influences and encourages perjury, mis-characterizes pleadings, engages in ex parte communication and misapplies the law.

 

I learned in court transcripts obtained in September she gave my abuser/batterer an illegal and unlawful order of protection against me.

 

4 months and days counting I have not seen or talked to my son. If I try and reach out to my son I WILL BE ARRESTED.

I have NEVER been accused of abuse.

 

I Get IT NOW: This is a Mockery of My Life:

After almost 2 years of noticing the judge was making a mockery of my life, and that these court hearings were nothing more than Bully Sessions for the judge to get her rocks off on me; I complained to the judicial committee.

 

Please Ask judge Morgenstern why she stole my son away from me?

This judge has put my son safety, sanity, and security at risk. He has been placed in a home where he has had guns pulled out and his life threatened. She placed him where there is drug use, drug selling and drug buying.

My Abuser was given Full custody. I have NO CONTACTN AT ALL.

The judge gave Full custody to an unemployed, illegal drug addicted/ alcoholic with a current criminal case for child abuse; He has no residence of his own. He attacked and assaulted my 15 year old daughter on June 27, 2012 while she held her brother.

The judge removed his case out of criminal court and put it in her court where it does not belong.

She dismissed his charges of abuse against me and my children in the past. This abuser has been unemployed from 2007 and does not pay child support for any of his children. This violation has caused my 16 year old daughter to bedepressed. She's getting counseling.

I NEVER THOUGHT THIS WOULD HAPPEN TO ME

Before this attack on my life I put my life savings in a location for HEAL Network. I was making 2-3k weekly as a nurse. (I will send Paystubs upon request) I never expected this would happen in a domestic violence court.

  • I have been prevented from protecting and loving my son.
  • I have been prevented from working.
  • I have been prevented from completing the HEAL Seniors program.
  • I want to help people get services and denounce judicial corruption.
  • I want to provide the services I PROMISED the youth and the seniors before I was devastated by this ordeal.
  • I want to buy my new baby diapers, blankets, clothing, and a bed.
  • I really need this story to be heard

           Help Me Turn my Pain into POWER!!!!

ALL money will go to the Turning Pain into Power project. This is The HEAL Seniors program first and Video-Blogging second because this judge plays a lot of evil, ruthless tricks and games. She crushes lawyers with her illegal tactics. She has done this to numerous families, and lawyers. Few victims in her court room have spent over $25,000 to $98,000.00 and still have been prevented being with their child or  from having a normal relationship with their child.

$5000 to fully complete the HEAL Senior's project. I started a HEAL Seniors program that was to launch this winter.  We provide free cleaning, cooking, errand services and meals to seniors at home alone. We provide transportation and meals to our interns and volunteers to provide these free services. The space also needs sprucing up, painting, and minor renovations. This is where we orientate the interns and sign up the seniors.

$1000 I need to buy video supplies to video-blog to get Howwee home and denouncing judicial corruption. I want to continue to tell my story as hundreds of thousands of families are going through these same situations.

$3500/for a lawyer unless one will help me for free-

$-Just sign my petiton and please help me fight back

Thank You

Other Ways You Can Help get Howwee Home and save HEAL Seniors program.

  • I know some people can’t contribute financially, but you are definitely helping:
    •    Even if you can't afford a cent, asking the media to cover this story, signing my petition, Tweeting or making some noise about my campaign means a lot to me.


Please sign my petition:
http://www.change.org/petitions/judge-esther-mo...
Please share my story. There are ruthless judges all over America.


Below is links to Stories of judicial corruption and children stolen

away from good parents placed with sexual/physical abusers.
http://www.mefeedia.com/watch/57095931?board=2652
http://www.mefeedia.com/watch/57138144?board=2652
http://www.mefeedia.com/watch/57095717?board=2652

story:
WHY MY EDUCATIONAL PRODUCT IS NEEDED

The English language industry is behind the times. There just isn’t enough content out there that will help Spanish speakers to learn English in an engaging and creative way. Dynamic English Lessons will change that. It is a unique platform containing English learning materials that are interesting and exciting. Best of all, membership will be highly affordable, setting it apart from other courses, which often charge many hundreds of dollars.

MY INSPIRATION

My name is Nadia Bentoua. When I was at school I became addicted to drugs and alcohol, and I was expelled from school with no qualifications and no prospects. The next 10 years of my life were very tough, but finally I was lucky enough to get help and – most importantly – get an education. I am now 33 and I live in Australia; I have been an English language teacher for about 10 years. My life experiences have shown me just how essential an education is for everyone, and this knowledge is what has inspired me to create Dynamic English Lessons.

WHAT IS SO BENEFICIAL ABOUT THIS PRODUCT?

Dynamic English Lessons will be a unique course. A lifetime fee will cost just $49, and this will give the user lifetime access to all learning materials. I want as many people in the Americas as possible to have access to high-quality English language education. There is nothing like Dynamic English Lessons currently available. We will teach English in a natural way; there will be no scripts and all lessons will be recorded at a natural speaking pace. English will be taught in real-life situations so all learners can be ready to hold actual conversations in English as soon as possible.

WHO WILL BENEFIT?

There are so many people in the Americas who want and need to learn English, especially because of the upcoming Olympic Games. Dynamic English Lessons will give them this great opportunity. Furthermore, half of the company profits will be donated back into needy communities in the Americas. For example, if 1,000 people from Colombia sign up, half of the profits will be invested back into Colombia, providing important resources such as classroom equipment or teaching costs. I plan to travel to Latin American countries myself to see where and how the money can best be used, in order to make sure it has the maximum benefit for the communities. But to do this, I need your help.

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO

I really need to raise funds in order to launch a publicity campaign throughout Spain and the Americas to raise awareness of the company. Such campaigns are very expensive. I need to pay for advertising in major newspapers, on websites and blogs, as well as to cover other marketing costs. With the right marketing, we can do so many good things and help so many people. We just need the right funding.

THE IMPACT

You will be helping to make a real difference in the lives of not just Spanish speakers who want to learn English, but also impoverished and underprivileged communities right through the Americas. You will be helping Latin American children gain access to a proper education, with the needed resources. This project means a lot to me, both because I want to help people to get an education and because I have great concern for so many disadvantaged Latin American communities. So please help me to help them, and invest in Dynamic English Lessons.

 

Thank you for your support!

 

You can check our Pre-Launch page here: http://www.DynamicEnglishLessons.com

 

Please get the word out!

Share link:  http://www.igg.me/at/Dynamic-English-Lessons

You will be helping Latin American children gain access to a proper education, with the needed resources. This project means a lot to me, both because I want to help people to get an education and because I have great concern for so many disadvantaged Latin American communities. So please help me to help them, and invest in Dynamic English Lessons.
 
Thank you for your support!
 
You can check our Pre-Launch page here: http://www.DynamicEnglishLessons.com
 
Please get the word out!
Share link:  http://www.igg.me/at/Dynamic-English-Lessons

story:
“Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.” Mahatma Ghandi

This is an important moment in my life where I have started to question my contribution to the world as well as my impact within it. 

I have been very fortunate to be offered a place to study MSc in Holistic Science at Schumacher College in the beautiful countryside of Devon, UK, where I have been volunteering for the past 2 months.

This campaign is not only helping me fund my tuition fess, but also begins a process of looking at the way in which gift economy can promote a gift education in which we share our skills, knowledge and means in order to empower others.

I want to pay your support forward after my graduation, by offering 100 hours of free documentary photography workshops to people who would struggle to afford them otherwise.

 

About me and Schumacher College

I am 23, I come from Romania and I am a documentary photographer, passionate about dance, theatre and storytelling as means of self-knowledge and empowerment.

The people that I have photographed and the different experiences I've been faced with have inspired me to rethink my work and to open dialogues on environmental and social justice.

Schumacher College is a place to re-evaluate our scientific understanding of nature and our role in a moment of ecological, economic and social change. 

The course combines many areas of interest for me, to an extent which I am sure will create many synergies within my thinking and current artistic practice as a documentary photographer. 

This year is a great opportunity to reflect on my work and to develop as an actively engaged human being. I believe in a rounded practice that involves head, heart and hands. Research, intuition and practice!

The 2 months of volunteering at the College have offered me a glimpse into a learning environment which is gentle, supportive and generous. I feel this model should be at the heart of any education.

I am deeply moved by the numbers of people that leave this place motivated and enthusiastic to make a change in their lives and communities towards wellbeing. 

That is why I decided to create a gift economy scheme in order to attend this unique course and immerse in a deep exploration of our Nature and ourselves. 

I invite you to join me on the journey!

   

Between What if ? and Why not?

The cost of tuition fees and accomodation for the academic year is approximately £19 500, out of which I still need to raise approximately £10 000 until the beginning of the programme in September 2013. 

When I was promised my first £100, something really shifted in me. I have realised that this is not my project, but a collective one. I became a catalyst for conversations, ideas and initiatives towards a different economy and education. 

I want to share my learning throught the master throught termly newsletters, articles, essay about innovative ways of being independent, sustainable and responsable. I will also open a forum of discussion with quaterly topics where I invite you to share amongst each other.

After graduation I will offer 100 hours of free workshops that will combine arts and science, my photography training and the wonderful insights of the MSc Holistic Science. 

 

Why pay it back, when you can pay it forward?

Sharing our knowledge and skills is one of the most valuable things we can offer to our society. Being able to ASK, to GIVE and to RECEIVE allows us to help and trust each other, to build responsible relationships in our communities. 

I want this initative to go beyond my degreee and to be the start of a snowball effect where gift education can be developed in a new model of funding education. Coming from a background with limited financial resources, I hope to reach other young people who are unable to easily access training.

Regardless of the financial result of this campaign, I am grateful to have been inspired and I wish to inspire others in the future.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you are unable to donate. Just spread the love and smile it forward!

Thank you for reading and supporting me! I am jumping over the moon tonight for this huge opportunity I have been given! :)

And don't forget that your gesture will have a long, fruitful and adventurous life; that can touch a lot of people and places through the gifts of learning. 

Warm wishes,

Delia

        


 

Contact me:

+ 44 (0) 7517 03 52 91 

              

info@deliaspatareanu.com

 

www.deliaspatareanu.com  and  http://youngproject.tumblr.com/

story:
Why now? Why this?

Today, the world is more connected than ever before. Yet as we grow closer, we have seen a rise in disputes over land, money, natural resources, culture, and religion. These conflicts have a direct impact on all of our lives, affecting us personally, and professionally — in our families, communities, and businesses. In order to create a more peaceful future — one that nurtures global understanding and compassion, while eliminating strife and alienation — it is vital to support the next generation of leaders in honing their voices and visions.

We believe that peaceful negotiation, global leadership, and ethical culture is best learned through hands-on experience in the natural world around us. By providing adolescents the opportunity to explore our ecosystem, the science of agriculture, and theater art, campers are able to shed previously held stereotypes and gain valuable knowledge about social, political, economic, and global relations.

 

How it all goes down.

Camp is based at The Vallarta Botanical Gardens, in conjunction with the University of Guadalajara, in the mountains of Jalisco, Mexico. Local teenagers, from a variety of economic backgrounds, travel to the gardens five days a week for seven hours per day. The camp community will prepare, serve, and eat lunch and snacks together, therefore eliminating any economic or professional stereotypes.

MORNING CAMP ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:

Discovery activities about the rich local ecosystem and animal species

Special workshops led by science specialists on their fields - such as jagars, bugs, and fish printing

Fun activities about recycling and the importance of conservation

Exploring the agricultural methods employed by the gardens

Hiking through the mountain trails

Swimming in the river

AFTERNOON CAMP ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:

Fun theater games that promote leadership and community

Group discussion and structured debate about campers’ communal and global responsibility

Improvisation exercises centered on the morning science lessons

Writing and improv activities centered on the creation of an original play

The camp session concludes with an original theatrical presentation, completely written, designed, directed, and performed by the campers. The theater piece will be based on the explorations, improvisations, writing exercises, and group discussions which occurred over the previous four weeks. This presentation will be performed at The Vallarta Botanical Gardens, for friends, families, and the garden patrons.

Terra Firma Summer Camp is led by a group of dynamic, professionals in the fields of theater and science. These teachers come together to share their knowledge and help lead campers in the pursuit of their own discoveries. Faculty includes:

Stephanie Bratnick, Camp Director

Stephanie has been a teacher in Chicago and New York City, for over eight years. She has spent the majority of her teaching career guiding children and teens in the development and creation of their own original theater pieces. She has also created the classical theater program for children at The Henry Street Settlement, where she teaches children Shakespeare and Chekhov. She has worked at Dalton, as a Seventh grade English teacher and a Sixth grade Theater teacher. Other programs she has taught at include The Wisdom Bridge Arts Project, in Chicago, and The Theatre Development Fund, in New York. She is the Artistic Director of Terra Firma Theatre Company. Currently, she teaches at The Girls Leadership Institute, as a Camp Educator and Workshop Leader. Her work at GLI centers on teaching emotional intelligence and healthy conflict resolution for adolescent girls.

Jennifer Newman, Educator

Jennifer Newman is a dancer who recently received her MFA from the Yale School of Drama in Production Management. She has performed on Broadway in Disney’s The Lion King and was a Radio City Rockette, and served as an associate producer for the Broadway production of The Color Purple. Jennifer has performed nationally and internationally with companies such as Los Angeles Contemporary Dance Theater, studied at the Alvin Ailey American Dance Center, and also had the immense pleasure of performing with Michael Jackson at Madison Square Garden.

Renata Melillo, Educator

Renata Melillo is an arts educator, collaborator and puppeteer. She has taughts for various theaters including the New Victory Theater, Sandglass Theater, CENTERSTAGE, Drama Learning Center, UCSCA, Silouhette Stages and Spotlighters Theater. Recent NYC credits include: Puppet Playlist #12: The Beach Boys, Alphabet Arts (Puppets & Poets Adult Workshop), Target Margin (The 2012 puppet re-enactment of the 1920 Bolshevik re-enactment of the STORMING OF THE WINTER PALACE, October 1917), St. Anne’s Warehouse (Radium Play). Renata specializes in puppetry and currently works for the New Victory Theater. She is also part of the executive team for the Amoralists Theater Company. Renata is a masters candidate in Educational Theater at City College.

Raquel Minerva Zamora Domínguez, Educator

Raquel was raised in Puerto Vallarta, where she attended the American School. She holds a BA in Biological Science from Wellesley College. Before coming to join the Terra Firma team, she worked conducting research on system sustainability, tropical ecology, thermal stress on coral reefs, and reef check protocol. She has worked with high schoolers at The American School, prepping them for a future of higher learning and is a passionate snorkeler.

 

What We Need & What You Get.

In order to bring this revolutionary youth program to reality, we need your help. Here are two ways to contribute:

1 Help us reach our indiegogo goal of $1,000. This money will go directly to paying for the following:

Transportation for the campers.

Camp uniforms, water bottles and sunscreen.

Art supplies, such as paint, markers, paper, and glue.

Healthy, local food for the campers’ lunches and snacks.

A notebook for each camper to record their own discoveries.

2 Help us provide scholarships to underprivledged teens. A donation of $250 dollars will pay for one camper tuition, who otherwise would not have the opportunity.

To thank you for your generousity and big hearts, you could receive a Terra Firma tote bag, a summer camp DVD, and a signed thank you letter from all the kids.

 

Help us support the voices of our next global leaders.

With your generous contribution, we will all be able to

         see a brighter and more peaceful tomorrow.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute funds, you can still lend a hand! Spread the word about our work by sharing the following link on your facebook or twitter:

http://www.vbgardens.org/sponsorcamp

Want to volunteer? Contact our Camp Director at youthprograms@vbgardens.org

story:
The ITASA planning team at UCLA has organized several events for this year’s conference. We have invited speakers for both the keynote presentation and workshops.In the next year, the Intercollegiate Taiwanese American Students Association (ITASA) – a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization – will celebrate two decades of community and network building among students from campuses all across the nation. For one weekend each year, regional conferences bring together hundreds of students together to connect and learn from each other. The aim of these annual conventions is to encourage attendees to explore their identities and to inspire and empower them to become active and influential leaders within their communities. 

After a two-year interlude, we are proud to announce that the ITASA 2013 West Coast Conference is set to be held at the University of California, Los Angeles on April 4-7th. Our theme for this year is “Crescendo: Voices of Taiwanese America,” which is inspired by the power of individual and collective expression. We believe that by exhibiting the Voice that lies within each of us, we can make progress as a community and create a positive impact on society.

However, this conference cannot happen without your support. This conference is expected to cost $33,950. Fundraising is where we need your help. Your contribution as a sponsor will not only empower this vision to create a generation of strong and confident leaders, but will also enhance your reputation among the collegiate community of students from some of the top-tier universities (e.g. Stanford, Berkeley, USC).

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at ucla@itasa.org.

 

THURSDAY, APRIL 4, 2013

06:00 PM - 10:00 PM .......................CHECK-IN / REGISTRATION
09:00 PM - 11:00 PM .......................BIG GROUP SOCIAL

FRIDAY, APRIL 5, 2013

08:30 CHECK-IN / REGISTRATION begins
08:30 AM - 10:00 AM .....................AMERICAN STYLE BREAKFAST
10:00 AM - 11:30 AM ........................OPENING SESSION (KEYNOTE SPEAKER #1)
11:30 AM - 12:30 PM .........................WORKSHOP SERIES 1: "Warm-up" (Identity)
12:30 PM - 02:00 PM ........................SMALL GROUP INTRODUCTIONS / LUNCH WITH SMALL GROUPS
02:00 PM - 03:00 PM .......................WORKSHOP SERIES 2: "Appassionato" (Passion)
03:15 PM - 04:45 PM ......................SCAVENGER HUNT
05:00 PM - 05:30 PM ......................SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES
06:00 PM - 08:00 PM ......................NIGHT MARKET
08:00 PM - 10:00 PM .......................BENEFIT CONCERT

SATURDAY, APRIL 6, 2013

09:00 AM - 10:20 AM ......................TAIWANESE BREAKFAST
10:30 AM - 11:20 AM .......................KEYNOTE SPEAKER #2
11:30 AM - 12:30 PM .........................WORKSHOP SERIES 3: "Statura" (Profession)
12:30 PM - 02:00 PM.......................LUNCH
02:00 PM - 03:00 PM ......................WORKSHOP SERIES 4: "Unisono" (Community)
03:00 PM - 05:00 PM ......................SOCIAL
07:00 PM - 10:00 PM .......................CLOSING CEREMONY/BANQUET
11:00pm AFTER PARTY

SUNDAY APRIL 7, 2013

08:00 AM - 12:00 PM...................CHECK-OUT
12:00 PM - 5:00PM......................tourLA (OPTIONAL)

 

洛杉磯加大 ITASA 策劃團隊為了本 次會議精心籌備了許多節目。在四 天的會議裡,臺美學生將參加介紹 台灣文化和勵志性的講座。我們邀 請了許多演講者為基調及研討會演 說。此外,學生也有機會親身體驗 台灣夜市,參與效益演唱會和閉幕 儀式/宴會。

本會議費用包括:設施/場地,廣 告/宣傳材料,演講者及住宿,會 議材料,策劃和宴會/閉幕儀式, 及餐飲。

請考慮不同贊助級別,其中包括更 多有關會議的信息和作為贊助商的 利益詳細信息。 

您對我們的慷慨贊助是本次會議不 可或缺的援助。我們十分感激您利 用您的寶貴時間閱讀我們的提案。 我們希望可以儘快聽到您的消息。 我們衷心感謝您。

如果您有任何問題,請不要猶豫與 我們聯繫。我們期待您的回應。 

在未來的一年中,臺美校際學生聯合會 (ITASA),一個 501(c)(3) 非營利性的組織,將慶祝 二十年以來為全國各地的校園的學生建立社會及關係。每年的一個週末,地區性會議召集數 百名學生一起團結和互相學習。這些年度會議的目的是鼓勵學生探索自己的身份和激勵他們 成為積極和有影響力的領導人。今年度的 ITASA 西岸會議訂於 2013 年 4 月 4 日至 7 日於 UCLA(加州大學洛杉磯分校) 

我們今年的主題是 “漸強:臺美的聲音“,啟 發於個人和集體表達的力量。我們相信透過 展示我們每個人的聲音,進展為一個共同體 去對社會產生積極的影響。

台裔美國人及台灣以一個整體被低估和任職 人數不足並不讓人感到意外,無論是在媒體 上,普查或國際上。在音樂裡,漸強的意思 是“逐漸壯大”。很多時候,我們的聲音含糊 不清或太微弱到聽不到。但我們的目標是改 變這個狀況,無論是透過藝術表現形式,政 治活動或慈善工作。我們的目標是提高音 量,使我們的聲音在我們的社區產生共鳴。

本次會議背後的核心價值是:熱情(我們要 鼓勵人們去追求自己的熱情。不管它是什 麼,因為我們對它的熱情使我們成為我們),多樣性的統一(儘管我們可能有不同 的職業興趣和來自不同的社區,我們的熱情 使我們一起促進台美社區 並統一我們),權 利(我們希望我們的熱情可以激勵其他人發 掘自己的身份,並找到自己內在潛能,成為 領導者的思維定勢來發揮更大的作用)。

然而,這個會議預計有 250 位學生參加及成 本$33,950 美元,沒有您的支持與貢獻是不 可能發生的。身為贊助者,您不僅能幫助培 養新一代的領導者,也提高您在頂尖大學生 中的聲譽。我們會依據捐獻金額,藉由各種方式來表示謝忱,包括:提供捐款抵稅單, 在會議手冊刊登廣告,提供夜市攤位,或是與其他臺美人士,學生共同參加閉幕晚宴。 您的參與將是提升台裔美國人能見度的關鍵。

We believe that by exhibiting the Voice that lies within each of us, we can make progress as a community and create a positive impact on society. 
However, this conference cannot happen without your support. This conference is expected to cost $33,950. Fundraising is where we need your help. Your contribution as a sponsor will not only empower this vision to create a generation of strong and confident leaders, but will also enhance your reputation among the collegiate community of students from some of the top-tier universities (e.g. Stanford, Berkeley, USC).










If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at ucla@itasa.org.






 
THURSDAY, APRIL 4, 2013
06:00 PM - 10:00 PM .......................CHECK-IN / REGISTRATION09:00 PM - 11:00 PM .......................BIG GROUP SOCIAL
FRIDAY, APRIL 5, 2013
08:30 CHECK-IN / REGISTRATION begins08:30 AM - 10:00 AM .....................AMERICAN STYLE BREAKFAST 10:00 AM - 11:30 AM ........................OPENING SESSION (KEYNOTE SPEAKER #1)11:30 AM - 12:30 PM .........................WORKSHOP SERIES 1: "Warm-up" (Identity)12:30 PM - 02:00 PM ........................SMALL GROUP INTRODUCTIONS / LUNCH WITH SMALL GROUPS02:00 PM - 03:00 PM .......................WORKSHOP SERIES 2: "Appassionato" (Passion)03:15 PM - 04:45 PM ......................SCAVENGER HUNT05:00 PM - 05:30 PM ......................SMALL GROUP ACTIVITIES06:00 PM - 08:00 PM ......................NIGHT MARKET08:00 PM - 10:00 PM .......................BENEFIT CONCERT
SATURDAY, APRIL 6, 2013
09:00 AM - 10:20 AM ......................TAIWANESE BREAKFAST 10:30 AM - 11:20 AM .......................KEYNOTE SPEAKER #2 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM .........................WORKSHOP SERIES 3: "Statura" (Profession)12:30 PM - 02:00 PM.......................LUNCH02:00 PM - 03:00 PM ......................WORKSHOP SERIES 4: "Unisono" (Community)03:00 PM - 05:00 PM ......................SOCIAL07:00 PM - 10:00 PM .......................CLOSING CEREMONY/BANQUET11:00pm AFTER PARTY
SUNDAY APRIL 7, 2013
08:00 AM - 12:00 PM...................CHECK-OUT12:00 PM - 5:00PM......................tourLA (OPTIONAL)
 



















洛杉磯加大 ITASA 策劃團隊為了本 次會議精心籌備了許多節目。在四 天的會議裡,臺美學生將參加介紹 台灣文化和勵志性的講座。我們邀 請了許多演講者為基調及研討會演 說。此外,學生也有機會親身體驗 台灣夜市,參與效益演唱會和閉幕 儀式/宴會。 
本會議費用包括:設施/場地,廣 告/宣傳材料,演講者及住宿,會 議材料,策劃和宴會/閉幕儀式, 及餐飲。 
請考慮不同贊助級別,其中包括更 多有關會議的信息和作為贊助商的 利益詳細信息。 




您對我們的慷慨贊助是本次會議不 可或缺的援助。我們十分感激您利 用您的寶貴時間閱讀我們的提案。 我們希望可以儘快聽到您的消息。 我們衷心感謝您。 
如果您有任何問題,請不要猶豫與 我們聯繫。我們期待您的回應。 




在未來的一年中,臺美校際學生聯合會 (ITASA),一個 501(c)(3) 非營利性的組織,將慶祝 二十年以來為全國各地的校園的學生建立社會及關係。每年的一個週末,地區性會議召集數 百名學生一起團結和互相學習。這些年度會議的目的是鼓勵學生探索自己的身份和激勵他們 成為積極和有影響力的領導人。今年度的 ITASA 西岸會議訂於 2013 年 4 月 4 日至 7 日於 UCLA(加州大學洛杉磯分校) 




我們今年的主題是 “漸強:臺美的聲音“,啟 發於個人和集體表達的力量。我們相信透過 展示我們每個人的聲音,進展為一個共同體 去對社會產生積極的影響。 
台裔美國人及台灣以一個整體被低估和任職 人數不足並不讓人感到意外,無論是在媒體 上,普查或國際上。在音樂裡,漸強的意思 是“逐漸壯大”。很多時候,我們的聲音含糊 不清或太微弱到聽不到。但我們的目標是改 變這個狀況,無論是透過藝術表現形式,政 治活動或慈善工作。我們的目標是提高音 量,使我們的聲音在我們的社區產生共鳴。 
本次會議背後的核心價值是:熱情(我們要 鼓勵人們去追求自己的熱情。不管它是什 麼,因為我們對它的熱情使我們成為我們),多樣性的統一(儘管我們可能有不同 的職業興趣和來自不同的社區,我們的熱情 使我們一起促進台美社區 並統一我們),權 利(我們希望我們的熱情可以激勵其他人發 掘自己的身份,並找到自己內在潛能,成為 領導者的思維定勢來發揮更大的作用)。




然而,這個會議預計有 250 位學生參加及成 本$33,950 美元,沒有您的支持與貢獻是不 可能發生的。身為贊助者,您不僅能幫助培 養新一代的領導者,也提高您在頂尖大學生 中的聲譽。我們會依據捐獻金額,藉由各種方式來表示謝忱,包括:提供捐款抵稅單, 在會議手冊刊登廣告,提供夜市攤位,或是與其他臺美人士,學生共同參加閉幕晚宴。 您的參與將是提升台裔美國人能見度的關鍵。

story:
HI Everybody!

YOU=LOVE, is celebrating its 10th anniversary with a grass roots effort to counteract hate in September of 2012 and we need your help!

YOU=LOVE needs your help and donation in order to donate copies of the “When animals agree, YOU=LOVE!” coloring book along with a lesson plan to give to teachers in inner city schools in an effort to have the valuable message heard by the children who need it the most.

YOU=LOVE is a message of human equality, a positive affirmation,  an anti-bullying message,  and a non-profit organization dedicated to spreading the power of love to the people who need it the most.

YOU=LOVE was created in 2002 as a response to the hateful acts of 911.
Since that time tens of thousands of YOU=LOVE stickers have been dispersed all over the world bearing the simple equation YOU=LOVE.

YOU=LOVE creator T. Klinkhamer and the YOU=LOVE team for the past 2 years have been spreading the YOU=LOVE message to the children who need it most through the colorful, educational, empowering children’s books –

“YOU=LOVE”

And

“When animals agree YOU=LOVE!”

 (authored by T. herself and illustrated by the Pittsburgh artist Dean Cercone).

To do this they have been doing workshops with kids and reading them the books at their schools with fun activities and coloring prompts.

The YOU=LOVE book teaches the values of kindness, sharing, loving one another, human equality, self love (self-esteem) and above all the power of love in a world that can at times be trying.

YOU=LOVE is a message of human equality, a positive affirmation,  an anti-bullying message,  and a non-profit organization dedicated to spreading the power of love to the people who need it the most.

HELP YOU=LOVE TO SPREAD TO THE MINDS AND HEARTS OF THE CHILDREN WHO MAY NOT BE RECEIVING THE LOVE THEY DESERVE!
HELP US REACH OUR GOAL OF $1,000 BY DONATING TODAY BECAUSE, “YOU ARE THE YOU IN YOU=LOVE!”

A big thanks to our lovely spokesmodel: Kristen Miller!

And to the voices of the children from Whitney Elementary School in Las Vegas, Nevada!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everybody, my name is Georgette Habashi, from the most exciting city in the world: Jerusalem.  I hold a B.A. degree from Bethlehem University in Business Administration (1989) and have worked for a variety of international non-governmental organizations including World Vision and EU projects. I am currently working at the Friedrich Naumman Foundation. Beside all of this, I hold different positions in local non-governmental organizations on their boards of administration.  Volunteer work is a way of life.  

Hot in summer ,  VERY cold in winter.  This is the weather in Palestine.

Blankets are essential in winter since heating is very expensive or not available. It is considered  a luxury if one has more than two for him or herself.  Palestinian families often share a blanket and some families don't even have them!!!  Needy families will appreciate a blanket as Christmas gift and won't see it as 'charity'. It will definitely add a to the holiday cheer, put a smile to their faces, and keep them warm!

Together,  we can do this. We are planning to assist between 300-500  families in Palestine by distributing the blankets to the urban areas, villages and refugee camps. North, south and middle of Palestine will be treated equally.  If your help and support exceeds what we have asked for, then more families will be added to the list.

How will we do this?

The first step is identifying and selecting the Palestinian families Our friendly local charitable humanitarian organizations and clubs will be informed about the work and they will help provide a list of needy families.

Then, different suppliers will be called to collect prices for blankets. The supplier with the most t economic price with a good quality blanket will be chosen. A good quality blanket will last for at least three years.

Lastly, we will secure transportation to deliver the blankets on time.  

Everyone knows about the political situation in Palestine, such a situation is beyond our control.  Yet caring, loving, giving and being human is within our capacity and one of the ways to show that is to work on securing the basic of needs of families who need support. Blankets in winter is basic, but as the Arabic saying goes, "one hand cannot clap" . We cannot do it without YOU. Your support and giving spirit is what we need and is the essential element to achieve to keep those needy families warm, healthy and add a smile and happiness during Christmas time.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our target to assist families is between 300- 500 families.  The flexibility depends on the spirit of giving.  But the plan goes like this:
  • For the blankets, with $15000, we will be able to purchase 500 blankets and help 500 families. Each family will get one blanket. $30/blanket * 500 blanket = $15000 
  • Transportation costs are $1000 to three different areas in Palestine.
  • Our goal is $15000 ($15000 for blankets + $1000 for transportation = $16000).
  • If we exceed our goal (and we hope this will happen!), we will use the money to buy more blankets and add more families to benefit from the "Christmas Gift" 
  • If we don't reach the amount called for, we will be sadly forced to reduce the number of families who will not have the opportunity to enjoy the "Christmas Gift.
  • Communication fees such a telephone bill and fax will be from our own pockets.
  • Why do we have a perk for the giving amount of $30+ and do we mean to have it like this? The answer is simply YES.  The amount will allow for one blanket for one family to be purchased and anything extra will be contributed to the cost for the transportation or will be gathered with the 'extra' contributions to buy another blanket for another family. 
  • Our perks are unique and also special.  Our perks are not commercial stuff but have  elements of art and design.  Most of our perks are handmade and reflect the Palestinian culture and heritage. We hope that our perks show our appreciation for our helpers and supporters. 

The Impact

Christmas is a time for giving... Anybody, would love to receive a gift at Christmas.

Your giving spirit will be seen as a Christmas gift and families will appreciate the value of the gift especially since a blanket is useful and needed at this time of year.  It's a "Two in One": a Christmas gift and a warm winter. 

Your part is valuable to us.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support on both levels, financially and emotional is much highly appreciated from the Palestinian community as such help means a lot to them.  

Spreading the word to everyone you know is just as valuable! More to that sharing this campaign on your social network is a great and huge help.

story:
Summary

My name is Jordyn Roe and I have chosen to donate my life. This is the work I was created for: to see the captives set free and the wounded healed. After I graduate from Southeastern University with my Bachelors in Journalism and Public Relations I will be volunteering for 3 months with Exodus Cry. As I spend time with like-minded world changers, I will have the opportunity to not only learn but to serve. This will help provide me the availability to spend my time working alongside people who are impacting the lives of those who are bound in the sex-industry around the world. You have the opportunity to donate your prayers and finances as I donate my time to this ministry. 

What it Covers & What Perks You Get

This funding will cover the following expenses:

  • Travel (including gas)
  • Rent
  • Food
  • Car Insurance
  • Daily Necessities
  • The continuing sponsorship of Luci Njeri, whom I have been sponsoring since I was 16 through the organization Compassion International. Just $32 a month pays for her housing, food and schooling. 
  • As you fund me, you'll receive some PERKS in the process. Look to the right-hand side to see the available perks for different donation amounts. 

The Impact

Funding this cause will not only impact the lives around me for 3 months, but this will impact my future ministry. Receiving this specific training will assist me in working towards furthering my knowledge of how the communications department is key to the success and impact of a non-profit organization. As many of you know, I am fully committed to working in full-time ministry and overseas missions. This is another step in my journey toward fulfilling this calling. 

 Other Ways You Can Help

  • PRAY for the end of the injustice of the sex industry and educate yourself about what is happening in the lives of hundreds of men, women and children.

Please watch the film 'Nefarious: Merchant of Souls'

http://youtu.be/Q-VC8AUE3Bc

 and also watch 'Sex+Money: A National Search for Human Worth.'

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GsY93C8cm54

 You can purchase these films at nefariousdocumentary.com and sexandmoneyfilm.com

  • Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the the Indiegogo share tools and post to Facebook, Twitter and your personal blogs. 

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you so much for watching and reading.
