story:
Our mission is to provide suicide prevention, intervention and postvention services that bring help, hope, and healing to those in crisis, and to provide education and training to individuals, groups, and professional organizations in the community on suicide prevention and suicide loss- all in an effort to save lives and reduce the impact of suicide upon the communities we serve.

What We Need 

THE CAMPAIGN... THE CRISIS LINES NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

WellSpace Health's Suicide Prevention program needs your support! Our goal is to raise much-needed funds through this campaign to enable us to both sustain and enhance the life-preserving work we do every day 24/7/365. Some people don't want to talk about suicide or think about giving to this cause until it impacts them personally. Please don't wait for a suicidal crisis to impact your life or your community to consider supporting the cause.  A donation of any size can help make a critical difference. By helping us to meet our online fundraising goal of $75,000, we will be able to sustain and even expand the capacity of these high quality crisis prevention, intervention, and postvention services we provide while we continue pursuing long-term funding solutions. 

This is our first major online giving campaign for suicide prevention- help us make it a success!  Please support the  suicide prevention crisis lines today.   We greatly appreciate each and every donation.  

Our goal is to raise at least $75,000 by June 30th. All money raised, whether or not we meet our goal, will directly benefit the Suicide Prevention Program at WellSpace Health, serving individuals and families in crisis throughout CA-and beyond. And... if we meet our goal, IndieGoGo will significantly reduce their standard campaign hosting fee to us- yet another reason to DONATE! 

We SO appreciate your donations- no matter the size- every contribution counts! EVERYone can play a part in preventing suicide and saving lives. Each share and every dollar help our fundraising goal become a reality, bringing us one step closer to reaching our goal.  HOPE starts here... with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some may not be able to contribute, but your assistance is still much-appreciated and needed with this campaign! 

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our giving campaign!
  • SPREAD the WORD  by using the share tools on our campaign page for Facebook, Twitter, and other social media as well as emailing your friends, family, and other contacts and encourage them to give and share the campaign as well.
  • Ask your employer to MATCH your giving to our campaign
  • Challenge friends, family, neighbors, or coworkers to match your donation 
  • Consider volunteering if you live in the Sacramento region. (Call 916.368.3118 to learn more). 

The Impact of Suicide: Serious Reasons to Give

  • Suicide is a serious public health concern and rates of suicide are rising. 
  • It is the 10th leading cause of death in the US and 2nd cause of death for youth (accidents are 1st).  
  • More die by suicide than homicide each year. 
  • Tragically 41,149 people died by suicide in the U.S (2013), an average of 112 per day. 
  • The rate of suicide in the US is 13 per 100,000 population and has been consistently on the rise for years. 
  • Suicide rates are highest among middle aged males  45-54 (19/100,000 pop). 
  • Comparatively in CA, many of the rural counties have much higher rates of suicide- we help individuals at risk in rural counties with 24hr access to emotional support, resources, and intervention. 
  • As rates of suicide and calls for help increase across the state and nationally, finding funding for suicide prevention crisis centers is a challenge.  Now is the time to give.
  • Suicide impacts so many in significant and sometimes traumatic ways each year. In 2013, an estimated  9 million adults had serious thoughts of suicide in the last year.  Among high school students, more than 17% (2.5 million)have seriously considered suicide and  8% report attempting suicide in the last year.  
  • A recent research based estimate suggested that  4.7 million are exposed to suicide deaths (Cerel, 2015)- an average of 115 suicide loss survivors per suicide. Among that average 115 loss survivors, 25 experience a major life disruption, leaving an estimated 1 million suicide loss survivors each year in serious need of support.  

*Data noted above is reported on CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention- http://www.CDC.gov ), AAS (American Association of Suicidolgy- http://www.suicidology.org), and SAMHSA (www.samhsa.gov/suicide-prevention) websites.  

WHO WE ARE...

For nearly 50 years, WellSpace Health (formerly The Effort), a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) offering primary care community health clinics, behavioral health care, pediatric dental clinics, substance abuse treatment, and more- has also operated the region's 24hr Suicide Prevention Crisis Lines. Nationally accredited through the American Association of Suicidology, a vital member of the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline network, the Suicide Prevention Crisis Lines serve callers of all ages- youth, adults, and older adults- from throughout Northern and Central California and beyond. We respond to crisis hotline calls from multiple lines 24 hours a day, 365 days a year from those callers in 916, 209, 530, and 707 area codes and beyond, as well as responding to the six suicide prevention crisis phones on the Forresthill Bridge. More than half of our calls involve suicide, and thousands of calls each year are callers at immediate risk of suicide. 

Our extensively trained crisis center team also provide the following services utilizing best practices in the field of suicidology:

  • Follow up calls to individuals at high risk of suicide after their initial call to the hotline.

  • Online emotional support with chat and text services.

  • Emergency Department Follow Up- 30 days of phone follow up after a suicide attempt or suicidal crisis to prevent re-attempts and re-admissions; includes assessments, safety planning, emotional support, and linkage to treatment resources. 

  • Educational presentations about suicide prevention and intervention equipping teenagers and adults to recognize warning signs and intervene effectively to prevent suicide.

  • 2-day ASIST (Applied Suicide Intervention Skills Training) workshops are regularly offered in the community, equipping many with skills to provide suicide first aid. 

  • Crisis Response after a high profile suicide, providing support and expertise and materials when needed most

  • Suicide Prevention and Suicide Loss materials outreach (wallet cards, brochures, posters)

  • Crisis response after high profile suicides

  • Content Expertise and media consultation

GIVE TODAY- every donation counts to sustain and expand these services!  
No credit card? No problem. Call 916-368-3118. Thank you!

story:
How you are going to Impact the World by donating: 

1. Save time – no more exausting teaching, kids will easilly learn by themselves

2. Support your teachers – no more weeks spend on teaching alphabet, this is a real tool that will ease primary school teachers work

3. Develop your kids imagination and creativity

4. Enjoy your family – by spending time together, singing, dancing along with the sunny animations characters


Reason why “Sunny, funny ABC’s”
http://abc.sproge.lv

Who of us hasn’t had their first school day and doesn’t remember the struggle to recognise all the letters, to learn how to combine them in order to read or write? None of our knowledge has come to us without an effort. ABC’s is the beginning of our way towards education and knowledge. In every country, teachers and parents have been looking for an easier way to teach their kids, whether it has been a well-known song or rhymes.

Children at the age of four, five or six years are more interested in games, singing, simply doing nothing, and nowadays also in computer games and other ‘exciting’ things presented by our society or/and internet; which make learning as a process look pale and uninteresting. But still we have to find a way to represent the world of knowledge and learning to kids. We have created a funny and easy way to help you as parents or teachers to interest our children in learning.



The goal

I have created the project “Sunny, Funny ABC’s” in English so that children all over the world can learn Alphabet with great fun and ease! Children love to learn, while they play and they love to play, while they learn. I offer different associations for children in the process of learning: visual, audial and kinesthetic. Children’s brains will make the necessary connections on their own and complicated things will be learned easily and effortlessly.



The idea

There are many letters in the Alphabet and they are usually linked to nouns. Also, the sequence of  the letters seems to be confusing to so many.  I have created a link between all letters of the Alphabet by creating stories, where I use nouns, adjectives and verbs. I have found the best matches for each letter!

There are several different characters that I use in this project, for example,  awesome beetle, gorgeous hippopotamuses, naughty octopuses, the royal spider and others. These characters form alphabetical order. The stories gradually turn into animations.

“Sunny Funny ABC’s” is a 2:57 minutes long,  very fun and educative animation.


How it’s made?

After generating the idea, comes the process of creating. Cartoon I am working on is as sunny as the title. Plasticine is a material that requires a personal touch, each frame is  gently handled from the idea to animator and to plasticine figure.


What I have accomplished  so far

All the characters are made from plasticine. And they have started to move. We are halfway through with the animation.


Characters

Awesome Beetle

- she is a real artist in her soul. She likes to color all the world around her. She is like an explosion.

Five Gorgeous hippopotamuses

 – they do have wings and they can inspire other creatures

The Royal Spider

 

- he is very clever, knows everything what is needed for happiness

Naughty Octopuses

- they like to play. Sometimes their games are pretty naughty, but they do a lot of good stuff while playing (but they also can do a lot good whilst playing)

Yellow Zebra

– together with Awesome Beatle they bring children to a wonderfull trip through all the letters. They are flying through the sky and swiming in the ocean in a little pea pods which contains all the letters and their stories. 

Ways you can help me

I need your help to finish the almost 3 minutes long plasticine animation.  I am the author of the script, the artist and the director.  My studio is full of plasticine. I know how to use it to make the most amazing things, but in order to complete the project, I need to hire animators, assistants and digital computer designers.  And here is where you come in.

This creative process provides a great feeling of happiness to all of us who are working to create the project. I hope very much that I can share my happiness with you, if only you agree to participate. Perhaps you can find ways to support the project financially or you could spread the word and share this message with your friends, so that it can reach all those who would like to make the Alphabet even more fun and let children perceive it: through pictures, song, dance and animation – as the most interesting and surreal story of all… To create spontaneous associations, so that letters line up one after another gracefully and with ease.

I really believe we can do it together. Thank you so much for taking your time to read about this project!


Risks and Challenges

"Sunny, funny ABC's" is coming close to a finish line. There is not a big chance for risks or problems to appear. Sure in case we wouldn't get enough funding we would be challenged to finish the cartoon as soon as we have hoped to. Even though we are half way through with shooting, there is still a lot of work to be done to complete the film, and this is where Your support becomes crucial - we still need to acquire more materials, ensure that the team is able to continue the work at the same productive pace which would finally lead to the editing and digital processing phase and finalizing the project.

Even though we are half way through with shooting, there is still a lot of work to be done to complete the film, and this is where Your support becomes crucial - we still need to acquire more materials, ensure that the team is able to continue the work at the same productive pace which would finally lead to the editing and digital processing phase and finalizing the project.

story:
Benvenuto! Come with me to Firenze ...

Welcome to my Study Abroad Campaign for this Spring Semester in Florence, Italy! 

Why Study Abroad?

"Being a tourist means that you are giving yourself a label that says to others that you are foreign or different. The purpose of living abroad is to incorporate yourself as much as possible with the locals, to truly give yourself a sense of the cultural and societal similarities and differences, and to ultimately give you a better understanding of yourself" . . . 

Growing up on a comfortable, charming little island, my father had a studio on our property where he was a working artist my entire childhood. Making my own attempts on the throwing wheel next to him, I always marveled at my dad's appreciation, love, and passion for pottery and ceramics. I could hardly contain my excitement and pride in elementary school when my dad would come to my class as our Art Docent. He would teach us about great Italian artists like Donatello and da Vinci. This sparked my dream to someday walk the same streets in Florence. 
 
Raised a modest life style, I was shown that if you work hard for something you can make it happen. Landing out of state at Chapman University was my first step in pursuing my passion for adventure. I'm hungry for a new culture, and long to experience a new way of life. Together, Chapman and Athena's unique Study Abroad program makes that possible for students with big dreams and even bigger determination. 

As a PR & Ad major, I am always looking for stories and creativity in the world around me. Florence will allow me to enrich my education while submerging myself in the culture, art, food, history, and personality of a the place I've always dreamed of. Athena's Study Abroad program in Florence surpasses my previous hopes of one day visiting Europe on a short trip. A semester abroad allows students to root themselves in a culture, and soak up the lessons in and out of the classroom, beyond the pages of a book or the impression of someone else's images.

The Impact

I was once told that, "the world is a book, and those who don't travel only read one page" . . . 

I have never traveled overseas, or anywhere outside of continental North America. For my semester abroad I plan to grow, not only as a student but also as a person. I hold myself to the expectations of being an exemplary student that feels privileged and gracious to have the opportunity of enriching my learning beyond the Chapman campus. The mission statement I strive towards as a student at my current University is to gain a personalized education of distinction that leads to inquiring, ethical and productive lives as a global citizen. I expect that I will further my fulfillment of this mission during my time abroad. 
        

Mangiamo!


"The Italians see food as part of a larger, more essential and pleasurable part of daily life. Not as an experience to be collected or bragged about - or as a ritual like filling up a car - but as something else that gives pleasure, like music, or a good nap in the afternoon."
 - Anthony Bourdain

The art, culture, food and people of Florence will provide me with a unique experience and understanding of life and learning outside of California, and outside of America. Academically, I plan to broaden my knowledge on an entirely different level as a student in an international educational setting. I plan to go outside my comfort zone through the opportunity of taking classes that I would never have had the chance to take. I believe that this time abroad will directly contribute to my development of a global citizen because I will be immersing myself in a place with a different way of daily life. I have felt very comfortable during my previous semesters at Chapman, and I now feel ready for the adventure abroad.

Ed infine.

For those of you who wish to help me through a contribution to my indiegogo campaign, I will be sharing the gifts of food, culture and the people of Firenze weekly with one new recipe from my Italian cooking class. I'm excited and won't stop until I reach my goal -- I hope you will join me.

I could hardly contain my excitement and pride in elementary school when my dad would come to my class as our Art Docent. He would teach us about great Italian artists like Donatello and da Vinci. This sparked my dream to someday walk the same streets in Florence.  Raised a modest life style, I was shown that if you work hard for something you can make it happen. Landing out of state at Chapman University was my first step in pursuing my passion for adventure. I'm hungry for a new culture, and long to experience a new way of life. Together, Chapman and Athena's unique Study Abroad program makes that possible for students with big dreams and even bigger determination. As a PR & Ad major, I am always looking for stories and creativity in the world around me. Florence will allow me to enrich my education while submerging myself in the culture, art, food, history, and personality of a the place I've always dreamed of. Athena's Study Abroad program in Florence surpasses my previous hopes of one day visiting Europe on a short trip. A semester abroad allows students to root themselves in a culture, and soak up the lessons in and out of the classroom, beyond the pages of a book or the impression of someone else's images.   
The Impact

I was once told that, "the world is a book, and those who don't travel only read one page" . . . 
 I have never traveled overseas, or anywhere outside of continental North America. For my semester abroad I plan to grow, not only as a student but also as a person. I hold myself to the expectations of being an exemplary student that feels privileged and gracious to have the opportunity of enriching my learning beyond the Chapman campus. The mission statement I strive towards as a student at my current University is to gain a personalized education of distinction that leads to inquiring, ethical and productive lives as a global citizen. I expect that I will further my fulfillment of this mission during my time abroad. 
        

Mangiamo!

"The Italians see food as part of a larger, more essential and pleasurable part of daily life. Not as an experience to be collected or bragged about - or as a ritual like filling up a car - but as something else that gives pleasure, like music, or a good nap in the afternoon."
 - Anthony BourdainThe art, culture, food and people of Florence will provide me with a unique experience and understanding of life and learning outside of California, and outside of America. Academically, I plan to broaden my knowledge on an entirely different level as a student in an international educational setting. I plan to go outside my comfort zone through the opportunity of taking classes that I would never have had the chance to take. I believe that this time abroad will directly contribute to my development of a global citizen because I will be immersing myself in a place with a different way of daily life. I have felt very comfortable during my previous semesters at Chapman, and I now feel ready for the adventure abroad.Ed infine.For those of you who wish to help me through a contribution to my indiegogo campaign, I will be sharing the gifts of food, culture and the people of Firenze weekly with one new recipe from my Italian cooking class. I'm excited and won't stop until I reach my goal -- I hope you will join me.

story: The money is for the travel costs. We have a concrete action to take to make reveal information about the senate investigation in 911. It is a fact that foreign governments had a role in the attacks. My congressmen has cosponsored a bill to get the 28 redacted pages declassified. I think a vital step in doing this is to get other congressmen to read them, I will go to NY and DC to meet with activist and then to meet my representative. We will lobby DC for day meeting as many reps as we can to get them to agree to read the 28 pages. I think the congressmen from NY will be the easiest considering their city was attacked. I will need as many people as possible calling them on the same days that we are there in person. This is constructive activism. I know 911 inside and out. This is how we can get something done, not with protesting in the park but by directly speaking to the people in charge as adults, as every American has the right to do. Those who have read the page have already changed how they vote on foreign policy.

story:
Campaign Summary

  • Did you know that a large number of young girls in Africa have poor hygiene leading to body odor and a lot of them cannot afford deodorant?
  • Did you know that poor hygiene and sanitation contribute to increased child mortality rate? (Source: UNICEF)
  • Did you know that 1 out of 10 school girls in Africa miss classes or drop out completely due to their period and substitute pads, tampons for less safe and less absorbent material such as rags, news paper and bark? (Source: UNICEF)
You're not alone if you didn't know, I too was awoken by these statistics.


Hi, my name is Nina Ijere-Otuka, an Atlanta, Georgia based business consultant and trainer whose services transcend beyond the shores of the United States extending to some African countries. My last business trip to a West African country, Nigeria, to be precise, led to research that revealed the statistics above. Subsequently, this has sparked a new movement that has become very dear to my heart - an urgent need to provide deodorants with other sanitary necessities to young girls in Africa!

Frankly, what started off as irksome, later led to my summoning up courage to accost some of the young girls that I came in contact with who had body odor problem. While it was not an easy conversation to initiate, in hindsight,I am so glad I did, remembering the smiles on their faces and their eagerness to learn more about personal hygiene. To the best of my ability, I shared some good personal hygiene habits with them and in addition, gave them money to buy some deodorants.

Thereafter, I thought  if they can't even afford a deodorant, who knows what they use during their monthly cycle. WOW! What difference it would make to be able reach a larger percentage of young girls with these sanitary necessities as doing so will help them practice good personal hygiene, increase their self esteem, self-worth and boost their confidence to enable them participate at par with their counterparts in the society at large all while smelling fresh :)


Your support will help us achieve our goal of providing at least 1000 young African girls with deodorants by December 2014, in time for Christmas. In addition, we would include other sanitary products to help them manage their personal hygiene better . We would start with young girls in Nigeria, since this campaign was inspired by my experience visiting Nigeria. With your support, we plan to visit other African countries.


Project Details:

We have grown to become quite passionate about this mission and are excited to not only provide deodorants with other sanitary items - a much needed necessity.

Additionally, we will teach them ways to maintain good personal hygiene. Doing these would help to increase her literacy about good personal hygiene while increasing her self confidence and subsequently enable her to SHINE BRIGHT in the community without any form of inhibition.

We hope that you would find fulfillment in putting a smile on the faces  of these young girls with your support during this Christmas holiday - a season of good tidings, joy and love!


Gift Bag/Hamper Content

Each personal hygiene gift bag/hamper will contain but not limited to the following:

  • Deodorant/anti-antiperspirant (of course)
  • Sanitary towels
  • Oral care items
  • Shaving items


As aforementioned, our goal is to start with Nigeria by giving out at least 1000 sanitary gift bags and later vist other Afrucan countries. To achieve this, we will need to raise at least $6,750 by December 18th, 2014. 
Indeed, 1000 beneficiaries might sound like a drop in a mighty ocean, but we believe that reaching ONE is better than NONE and we are committed to diligently utilizing the available resources to reach as many young African girls as possible. We will keep you posted of our progress with pictures, videos and blog updates.


We will be going into rural areas, that are not very sanitary, the roads are not as good to travel on, mainly dirt roads, water is not very good to drink, but someone need to do it and we are taking that step of faith in this movement.

As an appreciation for your kind gesture and support, we will send you a hand written thank you note from one of the benefiting young girls.


Additional Impacts:

The truth is that for less than what we spend on the average at a dinner in a restaurant; we are able to make a huge difference in the lives of these young girls. Your support will be a visible expression of love and care to them thereby motivating them to engage in activities that will build up their self-esteem. While interacting with them, our goal is to inspire them to know that they too are very capable of being leaders of tomorrow.


Further more, I am hoping that this campaign serves as a precedence to a broader vision of expanding this movement by creating viable platforms that will help to empower the girl child in Africa with personal development skills, education, leadership and hygiene education.


Other Ways You Can Help

We are counting on your generous support in this movement to reach out to a lot of these young African girls to assist them in practicing good personal hygiene which would boost her confidence while  helping to change her mindset to a more positive and moral approach to life.

Other than your financial support, please know that YOUR support can still be felt in these other areas:

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tool above to spread the news about this campaign to family & friends
  • Write us to say "Hello" or leave us a comment
  • Do come back to check on our progress and picture updates
  • Lastly, we are counting on you!


THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!


                                                               Photo Credits: Globalgiving.org, youthvoices.net

story:
Imagine one day you come home and realize your house is burnt to the ground. You have nothing left. All your clothing, computers, mattresses...worth thousands of dollars, gone. We all go through hard times, and that is when we need the most support. 

This "nightmare" became a reality for 6 Jewish college girls in Queens, NY this past week. All of them are from out of town without their parents here. They walked away with just the clothes on their back. 

Please help rebuild their lives. The $12,000 goal is just a minimum. Every penny raised will be given to them to repurchase everything they had lost in the fire.

Every penny raised will be given to them to repurchase everything they had lost in the fire.

story:
Armut unplugged 


BALD IST WEIHNACHTEN, aber für diese Leute ist es nichts als ein Wort, wenn sie vom Rest der Welt vergessen werden.....

ADVENTSKALENDER MAL ANDERS? Jedes Türchen ein Geschenk für diese Menschen - 1 Jacke, 1 Hose, 1 Decke, 1 Bett oder 1 Monat zu essen...einfach alles, was man zu einer Erstausstattung braucht.

Seit 15 Jahren hilft Happy Chidlren e.V. in Nepal  einem der ärmsten Länder der Welt mit viel Einsatz und Initiative notleidenden Kindern ebenso wie geschundenen Tieren.

Ob es der Kreislauf der Armut, die Schuldknechtschaft (ja, so etwas wie Sklaven gibt es auch heute noch) oder die Folgen der einst bürgerkriegsähnlichen Zustände sind: Hilfe und Hoffnung ist für diese meist Unberührbaren, die nie Achtung, Respekt oder Liebe erfahren haben, unermesslich wichtig.

Wo es immer noch Leibeigene gibt, die von Generation zu Generation in Schuldknechtschaft leben müssen; Kinderabeiter, die jeden Abend hungrig zu Bett gehen oder chronisch unterernährt sind; Kinder, die an so einfachen Krankheiten wie Durchfall sterben, wo es über 60% Analphabetismus gibt und mehr als 60 % der Menschen weit unterhalb der Armutsgrenze leben, in der Regel früh sterben müssen, weil sie kein Geld für den Arzt haben, dort tut Hilfe Not.

Kinder bedeuten die Welt von morgen, doch wenn man diese vielen traurigen Kinderaugen in Nepal sieht, erkennt man wie weit ihre Hoffnung auf eine Chance im Leben entfernt ist.

Für das einzelne Kind, für denjenigen, der verzweifelt und hungrig ist, ist es wahrlich nicht nur ein Tropfen auf dem heissen Stein. Für die kleinen Seelen, ist es das Leben. Wenn jemandem dadurch ein voller Bauch, eine Schulbildung oder sogar eine Operation ermöglicht werden kann, um das Kind von einer entstellenden Behinderung zu befreien, ist das viel –viel mehr, als sich dieses Kind je zu träumen gewagt hat!

Diese Kinder, für die wir nun in der Weihnachtszeit dringend Unterstützung suchen, lebten in bitterer Armut. Die junge Mutter wurde von ihrem Mann verlassen. Viel hatten sie auch vorher nicht. Sie arbeitete für den Grossgrundbesitzer, bekam lediglich 1 kg Reis als Tageslohn. Die 4 Kinder gingen nur zu oft mit knurrenden Mägen schlafen. Sie haben nichts: keine Hoffnung, keine Chance, keine Zukunft!

Helfen Sie diesen Kindern, wieder lachen zu können!


CHRISTMAS IS COMING SOON, but not for these people, if they will be forgotten from the world....

LET'S TRY A DIFFERENT ADVENT CALENDAR THIS TIME - open every day a door to make a gift for these people...1 jacket or 1 pant, 1 blanket or 1 month's food, just everything they need to start with.


Since 15 years Happy Children Trust is helping the poorest of the poor

Children are the world of tomorrow, but looking into their sad eyes, the chance of hope and a life in dignity is as far as the moon.

For one child our help means the world. 

Our Motto

We believe the most important is to teach destitute children honor, dignity, and self-respect. We can accomplish this by making sure that they all have

  • A full stomach
  • A safe and secure environment
  • An experience of being loved and a chance to develop social skills
  • A chance for a proper education
  • An experience of compassion, for that the children can learn to care for others

Our Mission

  • To help the underprivileged, homeless, and hungry children
  • To help the children who are cast away, forgotten, and left behind
  • To help the children whose lives are destined for slavery due to family debt
  • To help the poorest of the poor parents create the possibility of a happy future for their children
  • To care and educate the children in a beautiful and loving surrounding, inspiring them toward vocational or higher education
  • To make it possible for the children to grow up and integrate productively into society, so they can live successful, fulfilling lives with honor and dignity – and – to help others

Our dedicated and creative work is already making a difference for those we can reach. We love them, we nurture them, we teach them, we inspire them, we show them what’s possible. Our holistic approach gives the children a real chance to have a life that is neither slavery nor misery.

We use Montessori teaching methods for the little ones – and other creative programs where the older children have the possibility to discover their own talents. They engage in dancing classes, singing and art classes, yoga and Tai Chi to bring out their creativity and awareness.

Who we are

Our organization is Happy Children Trust Nepal. We’ve been certified as a respected and honorable non-profit charitable organization since 2000 in Germany and Nepal.

Thank you!

story: My Spanish instructor presented us with an opportunity to go on a trip to Peru for 2 weeks and it is a costly trip.. about $2,500 dollars. I'm 16 years old and I work part time. The trip is in July and I plan on having about $1,500 by then, but if I can gain enough money to go on this trip, I'd be forever grateful. Thank you in advance. -Lauren DeLuco

The trip is in July and I plan on having about $1,500 by then, but if I can gain enough money to go on this trip, I'd be forever grateful. Thank you in advance. -Lauren DeLuco

story:
If you are what you repeatedly do then it’s certainly true my father was a runner. In fact I can’t remember a time when my father, Zarrar Rahim Zubair, didn’t run, just as I can’t remember when his running ceased to be a habit all his own and seeped into my consciousness, impressing on me the importance of quiet discipline and persistence, signifying a commitment to something indefinably good and wholesome.


Like education, for example. A commitment to education has always been equally important to my family. My father spent over 30 years imparting management skills to fresh graduates and mid-career professionals as Director of the Pakistan Institute of Management, and most recently was the President of the Textile Institute of Pakistan. My mother has also worked in the education sector all for over 35 years. For us, going to school was a family affair.

A little over a year ago I lost my father to a sudden, unforeseen cardiac arrest. In the terrible months that followed I did mostly nothing. In fact I only vaguely recollect registering for the New York Marathon, so it was a surprise to me when I was selected to run. 

Having been selected, though, a plan began to form. I decided I’d run the marathon and try, in some small way, to contribute to education in Pakistan.

THE AIM: My intention is to combine two of my father's great loves: running and education... and to use one to further the other.

THE CAUSE: The Citizen’s Foundation is one of Pakistan's leading non-profit organizations in the field of formal education. As of 2015, TCF has established 1060 purpose-built school units nationwide with an enrollment of 165,000 students. TCF is recognised internationally, with chapters across the globe.

With your help, I’d like run the New York marathon to raise enough money to fund a TCF school in need for an entire academic year. This will enable almost 200 children to be able to continue their education.

The school that needs our help in the coming year is a primary school located in the community of Saleh Muhammad Goth, Bin Qasim Town, Karachi.

Next year the school's enrollment is expected to surge from 176 students to 194, all of whom will benefit from this donation. 
The campus has a female enrollment of 47%. This demonstrates the high level of importance given to female education by the community. 

For more information on TCF and its work, go to: www.tcf.org.pk 

WHAT I'M DOING: The New York Marathon is a grueling 26 mile run, and I’ve been training for it for the past six months! I’ll be sharing my preparations for the marathon on my Facebook page so you can stay involved!

For updates on my training and TCF's work, go to my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/HamnaRunsForTCF

HOW YOU CAN HELP: Every little bit helps, whether it’s $5 or $500! Please spread the word, tell your family and friends! 

And when you donate, please go ahead and donate in the memory of someone you love. Email us at hamnaruns@gmail.com and tell us your story, and we'll share it on our Facebook page. This campaign is about celebrating the people who mean the most to us and finding a way to pay it forward.

Every dollar donated will motivate me to take that extra step towards the finish line – I’m counting on your support! 

Thank you!

Next year the school's enrollment is expected to surge from 176 students to 194, all of whom will benefit from this donation. 
The campus has a female enrollment of 47%. This demonstrates the high level of importance given to female education by the community. 


For more information on TCF and its work, go to: www.tcf.org.pk WHAT I'M DOING: The New York Marathon is a grueling 26 mile run, and I’ve been training for it for the past six months! I’ll be sharing my preparations for the marathon on my Facebook page so you can stay involved!For updates on my training and TCF's work, go to my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/HamnaRunsForTCF

HOW YOU CAN HELP: Every little bit helps, whether it’s $5 or $500! Please spread the word, tell your family and friends! 

And when you donate, please go ahead and donate in the memory of someone you love. Email us at hamnaruns@gmail.com and tell us your story, and we'll share it on our Facebook page. This campaign is about celebrating the people who mean the most to us and finding a way to pay it forward.



Every dollar donated will motivate me to take that extra step towards the finish line – I’m counting on your support! 


Thank you!

story:
We are a team of Vavylon project and we are pleased to present you idea for the development of our future. These changes will affect anyone, who wants to be successful.

   Unfortunately in today’s rapidly developing world, higher education institutions use outdated programs and technologies for students.

    For example, when you want to work as a waiter, you have to be able to communicate with clients, and the employer requires it, so for this reason he or she instructs you.We created the platform for entrepreneurs who are looking for skilled staff and employees in a particular company.

   Studying at the university doesn’t guarantee us the work of dream. Why don’t study exactly what you need for the work of your dream. There are people who have got to the desired job, but what about others? And so we decided to help everyone. 

 Interview with Coca Cola Ukraine Staff Director

  In addition to hiring staff, the company annually accepts 10 students for internships, most of which it subsequently employs on a permanent basis. Often interns come to the office departments, in particular, in the personnel department, marketing, procurement and IT. "I would like more trainees to come, but it depends not so much on us, but on the specifics of education," explains the director of the staffing service.

"We not only attract students - we carry out a comprehensive selection. Candidates for  trainees pass a series of tests. We check students' ability to interpret verbal and financial information, elementary professional knowledge and skills, how fast he can solve logical problems, and is able to work with figures. During the interview we pay attention to such qualities as leadership and active life position, purposefulness, willingness to work on the result and the desire to learn. I can say from my experience that competent people come to us and they understand what they want.

Last year, 200 students came to the test (after the preliminary selection on the basis of the resume), 50 of them reached the stage of the interview, and only 10 of them were accepted for the internship, "says Irina Bryzhak.

Click on the picture of Coca Cola, and go to the article on this topic.

The question of employment is so relevant that it is risen at all levels. Click on the picture of Forbes, and go to the article on this topic.

The Advantages of Vavylon

  Everyone can buy online training, in particular the knowledge that the employer requires.

  • You don’t need to spend money and time at the university, develop yourself and work where you dream to. Be responsible for your future, start building it yourself.
  • Training from any company- is an invaluable knowledge that can be the foundation for a successful future career.

  All the best companies at one place- this is a Vavylon.

  Modern business giants need the best specialists. But how to become such a specialist when the Google university doesn’t exist.

  The best way to discover who is needed at the company is to ask. On a platform, a certified company can place its specific training with the requirements of the employee.

   Anyone who is interested in the work of dreams, has the opportunity to get qualified training and get a position in a particular company. The company is able to evaluate the achievements of the candidate and ensure his competence at the end. Every company is interested in hiring good staff but we should remember that they also appreciate human qualities.

   We understand that self-education in the modern world is of great importance, but there are no resources for learning what is needed. All people are dreaming of working in promising companies. We decided to erase all restrictions and make the knowledge available to everyone.

 Self-education has many advantages over classical education and this issue is highlighted in a lot of resources. Click on the picture and follow the link. 

   A large number of talented people lose their chances for a confident future, and unfortunately, their enthusiasm, purposefulness and persistence are not realized as much as possible.

   Our ideals are means that people can realize themselves, learn something new for themselves. The modern world is very rapid and it’s impossible to study everything. Why can’t you teach exactly what interests you without leaving your home? We want to change the outdated system of education and employment of workers. We want to accelerate the pace of development of the modern world. Our task is to facilitate work for companies and employees, saving time and money.

  Let’s change the future together. Vavylon!

 

System of investment of bonuses

  • Investments up to $ 100-fast development of the project.
  • -$100 -training of the chosen company for the same amount;
  • -$200 - training from a company that is interest up to $ 3 000.
  • -$ 500 - training for any vacancies from the three selected companies to $ 7 000;
  • - $ 1 000 - training for any vacancies from seven selected companies, regardless of price;

    Invest now and receive training for the vacancy from any company of your choice. The company can evaluate the training from $ 10 to $ 10 000 and more. Therefore, investing now you will get maximum benefit.

The system of using finance

  The minimum amount required to implement our project is $ 500 000. To negotiate with five companies (according to results of voting) about the creation of training required: $ 250,000;

  Education advertising (in SMO, SMM and contextual advertising):$ 200 000 ;

  Server maintenance and salaries for programmers during the year: $ 50,000;

  In order to develop and present its own training by each company on the platform Vavylon, with the confidence that buyers need it, we will offer them an advance of $ 50,000.

  For a quick and reliable start, the project needs $ 10,000,000

  Depending on the amount of funds raised, we will make into an agreement with the companies ,which will collect the most votes on the platform Vavylon, taking into account your wishes, which you will specify when investing.

  We have already invested in the development of the project and the development of the site - $10,000; to promote the site in the number of visits to 100,000 people - $ 120,000; office rent - $ 2 500; regional activity (booklets, brochures), etc. - $ 22 500.

  The total cost has already reached $ 155,000

  Vavylon.net visit statistics.

 

 

 

 

The principles of work of Vavylon.net site

Company:

  1. Creates its own course of study.
  2. Registers on of Vavylon.net site and verified (Training can place only those companies which can establish you for a work).
  3. Places its training on the site and puts the price.
  4. The placing cost of services is 10%.
  5. Vavylon Platform advertises free training.
  6. After the sale, the money is credited to the personal cabinet.
  7.  The company receives information about the buyer, after it can ask for an interview.

Customer:

  1.  Registration on the Vavylon.net site.
  2.  Finds a company and a vacancy he is interested in.
  3.  Buys and studies training course.  
  4. After  passing the exams successfully the buyer receives a certificate from the company.
  5.  Has the enterviews.
  • Evanesyan Sarkis –CEO Founder
  • Scherbina Volodimir  - CFO  Co-Founder
  • Boiko Vialii - COO
  • Stepyak Svyatoslav –CMO
  • Dovbish Dmitro  - (company lawyer)
  • Poberezhyts Vitalii –CAO
  • Nizinkovska Alina – HR Director
  • Dembitskyi Andrii – PR manager
  • Kovach Viktoriia – CCO
  • Rui Yurii -   CIO

story:
WHY THIS ONLINE COURSE?

Being in your 20s or 30s it's also confusing. It's painful not to know what's next in your career. 

I'm a millennial who's spent most of the time at the beginning of his twenties in crappy jobs, always asking if there's anything else out there. 

Then I realised I'm not the only one. Most of us hate our jobs yet we don't have a solution to fix this problem. 

I have tried everything from personality tests, reading books on this topic, asking friends, colleagues, mentors what I should be doing with my life but all of them failed. 

After 5 years I have managed to find my purpose in life and now I'm following it.

In the process, I have found a formula that helped me and thousands find our ideal career. 

So I created an online course to help 20s and 30 identify their unique career path and follow it so that they will get into a job in which they can help others, have a positive impact and get paid for doing what they love. 

The course is available offline as a workshop and has been used by the Canadian Government to help thousands of millennials find and follow their unique career path.  Here's one millennial who went through the workshop. 

However, we realised it wasn't cheap and there wasn't an online version. 

You had to attend a face to face workshop in Canada or very few other countries in Europe.

So we collaborated with Steve, its creator, locked ourselves in a room for 6 months and didn't get out until we created the Millennial Hero Experience, the Wolrd's First Career Decision Experience for Millennials.

 

What We Need & What You Get

10 Easy Modules, all the steps you need to identify and follow your ideal career path:

 

 

The Impact

We're trying to end the whole millennial stereotype. Because for each person buying the full Millennial Hero we will donate another Online Course to unemployed millennials who grew up in orphanages and cannot afford the programme.
